translated: then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for teaching in return for even a little food.

original: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he teaches without being motivated by a desire for food.

original: dge slong de nyid dam gzhan la smras pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong de nyid dam gzhan la smras pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he says to the nun herself or to someone else, “I will teach.”

original: pha rol pos don go ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol pos don go ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other person understands the meaning.

original: bza' ba lnga dang / bca' ba lnga dang / dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung bas phyar ka gtong ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga dang / bca' ba lnga dang / dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung bas phyar ka gtong ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he teaches in return for any of the five kinds of fresh food or the five kinds of cooked food, or in return for any of the requisites of a monk.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The perpetrator of this downfall is a monk who teaches a nun in return for food.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall has five branches:

original: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong dang / zas cung zas kyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa dang / de la dge slong 'di zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes phyar ka gtong ba dang / de nyid dam gzhan la smras pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong dang / zas cung zas kyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa dang / de la dge slong 'di zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes phyar ka gtong ba dang / de nyid dam gzhan la smras pa dang /
translated: The one who is criticized is a nun.

original: pha rol pos don go ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol pos don go ba'o //
translated: The one who understands the meaning is the other person.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, then the downfall is a partial defeat or a serious violation, depending on the case.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as the monk who is preparing to teach the nuns for the sake of a little food has not yet reached the actual basis, he commits a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that he undertakes, he commits a minor infraction.

original: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the monk who teaches the nuns is attached to the nun or has violated his vow of chastity, he commits a minor infraction.

original: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nye byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nye byas so //
translated: A monk who teaches a nun out of desire for her, or who is a cause of her degeneration, commits an offense.

original: pha rol pos don mgo ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: pha rol pos don mgo ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person does not understand the meaning, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct in the preparatory stage is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as there are preparatory stages, there are that many offenses of wrong conduct in the preparatory stage.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct in the preparatory stage of an offense of wrong conduct is also an offense of wrong conduct, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston pa bden na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston pa bden na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if a monk teaches a nun out of a desire to benefit her, and the nun understands the meaning.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the first offense, if he is insane, if his mind is deranged, if he is overwhelmed by pain, or if he is joking.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //🔽dge slong ma'i @99a * //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o // dge slong ma'i @99a * //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not serving in any way for the sake of even a little food in any place and at any time.🔽The Dharma of the nuns

original: chos 'dri ba la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos 'dri ba la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: is to be fearless in asking questions of the monks.

original: dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should give food to the nuns.

original: rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag pod dang / shur bu phre'u yang dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag pod dang / shur bu phre'u yang dbul bar bya'o //
translated: They should also give them needles, thread, and sewing kits.

original: dge slong gis kyang de dag blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de dag blang bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should accept these things.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the explanation of the twenty-third training rule on serving.🔽The chapter on the training rule on giving cloth

original: // / gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī,

original: mnyan yod na tshong dpon zhig 'dug pa des /
analyzed: mnyan yod na tshong dpon zhig 'dug pa des /
translated: There was a merchant in Śrāvastī

original: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed dga' bar byed /
analyzed: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed dga' bar byed /
translated: who took a wife from a family of equal rank. He enjoyed himself with her,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: took pleasure with her, and made love to her.

original: de rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nye du zad par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nye du zad par gyur cing /
translated: When he grew old, his relatives died,

original: nor zad pa dang longs spyod zad par gyur nas des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: nor zad pa dang longs spyod zad par gyur nas des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: his wealth was exhausted, and his enjoyments were exhausted. He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo kho bos da nor bsgrub par mi nus kyi kho bo rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzang mo kho bos da nor bsgrub par mi nus kyi kho bo rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o //
translated: “My dear, I can no longer acquire wealth, so I will go forth.”

original: chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: chung mas smras pa /
translated: His wife said,

original: rje'i sras bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: “Lord, I too will go forth.”

original: des chung ma 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i la gsol te /
analyzed: des chung ma 'di skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i la gsol te /
translated: He asked Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī for his wife,

original: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so //
analyzed: rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so //
translated: and she had her go forth and be fully ordained.

original: rang yang rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
analyzed: rang yang rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
translated: He himself went to Jetavana,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la gsol nas rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs so //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la gsol nas rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs so //
translated: asked the saṅgha of monks, and went forth and was fully ordained.

original: mnyan yod na de grags shing bsod nams che bas thams cad kyis mnyan yod pa'i tshong dpon rab tu byung ngo zhes thos nas /
analyzed: mnyan yod na de grags shing bsod nams che bas thams cad kyis mnyan yod pa'i tshong dpon rab tu byung ngo zhes thos nas /
translated: He was well known and had great merit in Śrāvastī, so everyone heard that the Śrāvastī guild master had gone forth.

original: de la chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / na ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag 'bul bas des de dag grub po //
analyzed: de la chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang / na ba'i rkyen dang / sman gyi yo byad dag 'bul bas des de dag grub po //

original: drug sde dag log ste ras yug chen de brgyangs nas dras shing drubs te 'char kas snam sbyar de dang tshon sna lda pa'i skud pa khyir te 'chag tu song nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag log ste ras yug chen de brgyangs nas dras shing drubs te 'char kas snam sbyar de dang tshon sna lda pa'i skud pa khyir te 'chag tu song nas /
translated: The group of six saw the large piece of cloth, and they unrolled it, cut it, and sewed it. Udayin took the patched robe and dyed thread and went for a walk.

original: snam sbyar de la tshon sna lnga pa'i skud pas bdag nyid sbed ma'i mgul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa zhig skud ris su btsems nas bltab ste /
analyzed: snam sbyar de la tshon sna lnga pa'i skud pas bdag nyid sbed ma'i mgul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa zhig skud ris su btsems nas bltab ste /
translated: He stitched the five-colored thread into the patched robe and wrapped it around Siṃha’s neck.

original: sped ma la byin nas /
analyzed: sped ma la byin nas /
translated: He gave it to Siṃha and said,

original: re zhig ji srid du mtshon gyis ma bcal ba de srid du ma dbye shig / ltung ba dang bcas par gyur ta re zhes smras so //
analyzed: re zhig ji srid du mtshon gyis ma bcal ba de srid du ma dbye shig / ltung ba dang bcas par gyur ta re zhes smras so //
translated: “Do not unwrap it until you have cut the cloth with a knife. Otherwise you will be at fault.”

original: sbed mas snam sbyar de de bzhin kho nar dbyar khang du 'phags pa dang / dge slong ma grogs mo dag gis 'phags pa 'char kas snam sbyar ji ltar btsems pa blta'o 'on cig ces byas pa na sbed mas ma ster nas /
analyzed: sbed mas snam sbyar de de bzhin kho nar dbyar khang du 'phags pa dang / dge slong ma grogs mo dag gis 'phags pa 'char kas snam sbyar ji ltar btsems pa blta'o 'on cig ces byas pa na sbed mas ma ster nas /
translated: The nun friends said, “Noble Pūraṇa, let’s see how Noble Udayin sewed the robe.” When Pūraṇa did not give it to them,

original: de dag gis snam sbyar hud ces phrogs nas phye ste bltas pa dang / de la tshon sna lnga pa'i skud pas 'char ka sbed ma'i mgul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa skud ris su btsems pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag gis snam sbyar hud ces phrogs nas phye ste bltas pa dang / de la tshon sna lnga pa'i skud pas 'char ka sbed ma'i mgul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa skud ris su btsems pa mthong nas /
translated: they snatched the robe and opened it up. They saw that Udayin was sewn into it with five-colored thread, embracing Pūraṇa around the neck.

original: de dag gis rta gad kyis btab ste smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis rta gad kyis btab ste smras pa /
translated: They laughed and said,

original: sbed ma khyod la 'phags pa 'char kas yun ring mo zhig gis gzod 'khyud do //
analyzed: sbed ma khyod la 'phags pa 'char kas yun ring mo zhig gis gzod 'khyud do //
translated: “Pūraṇa, it’s been a long time since Noble Udayin embraced you.”🔽Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī heard about this

original: de skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is thos nas /
analyzed: de skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is thos nas /
translated: and said,

original: nu mo dag drug sde gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa dag gis 'drum pa ltung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'jig par byed do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: nu mo dag drug sde gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa dag gis 'drum pa ltung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'jig par byed do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: “Sisters, the group-of-six are acting badly and are destroying the teaching of the Blessed One with their downfalls.”🔽The nuns told the monks,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la rmas nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this event, because of this cause, because of this situation, gathered the saṅgha of monks and asked the venerable Udayi,🔽“Is it true, Udayi, that you did this?”

original: dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not suitable for a monk,🔽it is not allowable,🔽it is not proper,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not worthy of a renunciant,🔽it is not to be done.”

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: And he censured him in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis @101b 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis @101b 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I have laid down this basis for training for my disciples:

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed na ltang byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed na ltang byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: “If any monk makes robes for a nun who is not a relative, there is an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags /
translated: The person was the monk Udayī. The affliction was attachment.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa'o //
translated: The offense was making robes for a nun who was not a relative.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If any monk” means

original: 'char ka 'am /
analyzed: 'char ka 'am /
translated: Udayī,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or anyone else like him.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “Nun” means a follower of this doctrine.

original: nye du ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Who is not a relative” means

original: phyi mo dang mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la /
analyzed: phyi mo dang mes po dang / phrugs kyi bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la /
translated: that relatives are those up to and including the seventh generation of grandparents and great-grandparents.

original: de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
translated: Those beyond that are not relatives.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zang ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko ta ma pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zang ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko ta ma pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: “Cloth” means any of the seven kinds of cloth: wool, linen, cotton, silk, coarse cloth, felt, or gauze.

original: byed na zhes bya ba ni 'tshem na'o //
analyzed: byed na zhes bya ba ni 'tshem na'o //
translated: “If he makes” means if he sews.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the offense should be understood in terms of the basic offense, the preparatory action, the preparatory action of the preparatory action, the non-offenses, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni //
translated: Here, the basic offense is as follows.

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pas gos rung ba 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa byed na gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pas gos rung ba 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa byed na gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, perceiving someone who is not a relative as such, makes a robe for a nun who is not a relative, then, if the robe is suitable and measures three handspans in length and two in width, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the nun is not a relative, but the monk perceives her as such, or if he is unsure of it, there is no offense.

original: gos rung ba dang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa dang / gos de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gos rung ba dang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa dang / gos de las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the robe is suitable, but does not measure three handspans in length and two in width, or if it exceeds those measurements, there is no offense.

original: 'tshem pa la sogs pa byed pa'i rnam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'tshem pa la sogs pa byed pa'i rnam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he sews it, or does any other work on it, there is no offense.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent in this downfall is🔽a monk who perceives someone as not being a relative.🔽The basis of the downfall is

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: a nun who is not a relative.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is committed by five factors:

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / gos rung ba 'khor gsum @102a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / gos rung ba 'khor gsum @102a * //
translated: a suitable cloth that covers the three areas,

original: khebs pa'i tshad yan chad dang / byed pa dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: khebs pa'i tshad yan chad dang / byed pa dang / zin pa'o //
translated: the action, and completion.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors are incomplete, then the downfall is a partial one, depending on the case.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparations for the downfall of making robes for a nun but has not yet reached the actual downfall, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa dang / nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so //🔽mtshan mi mthun pa nye du ma yin pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa dang / nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so // mtshan mi mthun pa nye du ma yin pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual downfall that one has begun, there is a minor offense.🔽If the nun is not a relative, or if she is degenerate or unattached, it is a minor offense.

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the nun is not a relative, but one perceives her as such, or is unsure of it, it is a minor offense.

original: gos mi rung ba dang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du ma chog pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gos mi rung ba dang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du ma chog pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the cloth is unsuitable, or if it does not cover the three areas, it is a minor infraction.

original: byed du bcug ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: byed du bcug ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes another do it, it is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The infraction of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor infraction, and the preparation of the preparation is also a minor infraction, a minor infraction.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong ma nye du la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong ma nye du la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the nun is a relative.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gos byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gos byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not using all the cloth in all situations.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: gos byed pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu lnga pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gos byed pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu lnga pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-fifth downfall.

original: // / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /🔽bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni / bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The introduction to the downfall of traveling with a nun

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: There are two types of downfalls: those that are proscribed and those that are permitted.🔽The introduction to the proscribed downfalls

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' lhung bzed nag po can 'di dag rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
translated: “Nandaka and Upānanda, these monks with black bowls, even when they go out with their legs smeared with monkey grease, they obtain the provisions of those who are about to leave.

original: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
translated: When they return, they obtain the provisions of those who have arrived unexpectedly.

original: skye bo mang @102b po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang @102b po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They are liked by many people and are pleasing.

original: yu bu cag ni khron pa'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong /
analyzed: yu bu cag ni khron pa'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong /
translated: We, on the other hand, are like turtles in a well. We do not go anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa thob pa dang / skye bo mang po la dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar ga la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong bas rnyed pa thob pa dang / skye bo mang po la dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar ga la 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since they do not come from anywhere, how can they be obtained, be pleasing to many people, or be attractive?

original: yu bu cag kyang ljongs rgyur 'dong ngo zhes de dag dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du dong ste /
analyzed: yu bu cag kyang ljongs rgyur 'dong ngo zhes de dag dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du dong ste /
translated: “We too will go on a journey.” They went to the nuns’ rainy season retreat house

original: dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag lam brgyags sbyor du bcug nas de dag kyang khrid cing /
analyzed: dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag lam brgyags sbyor du bcug nas de dag kyang khrid cing /
translated: and made the group of twelve nuns prepare provisions for the journey.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid de ljongs rgyur 'phags so //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid de ljongs rgyur 'phags so //
translated: They also took along a monk who lived on alms. They set out on their journey.

original: de dag gis gang gi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis gang gi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
translated: When they had gone outside the boundary, they said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis 'khod par byas /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis 'khod par byas /
translated: “Nandā and Nandabalā, how long must we put up with the behavior of others?

original: tshur shog bdag cag rang rang gi spyod lam gyis 'khod par bya'o zhes dang por dga' bo 'dug nas de'i 'og tu dga' mo 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og
analyzed: tshur shog bdag cag rang rang gi spyod lam gyis 'khod par bya'o zhes dang por dga' bo 'dug nas de'i 'og tu dga' mo 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og
translated: Let us sit down in our own order.” First Nanda sat down, then Nandabalā, then Nanda’s student, then Nandabalā’s student,

original: tu dga' bo'i dge tshul 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i dge tshul ma 'dug go //
analyzed: tu dga' bo'i dge tshul 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i dge tshul ma 'dug go //
translated: then Nanda’s novice monk, then Nandabalā’s novice nun.

original: de bzhin du nye dga' dang / gtsug dga' mo la sogs pa yang spel mar bkod de dong do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nye dga' dang / gtsug dga' mo la sogs pa yang spel mar bkod de dong do //
translated: Upananda, Śirasā Nandabalā, and so on, were also seated in order.

original: don mthun de dang bram ze zhig lhan cig 'gro ba des de dag mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: don mthun de dang bram ze zhig lhan cig 'gro ba des de dag mthong nas smras pa /
translated: A certain brahmin who was traveling with the caravan saw them and said,

original: 'di ni dge sbyong yin /
analyzed: 'di ni dge sbyong yin /
translated: “This is a monk.

original: de'i chung ma ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i chung ma ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his wife.

original: de'i bu ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i bu ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his son.

original: de'i mna' ma ni 'di yin /🔽de'i tsha bo ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i mna' ma ni 'di yin / de'i tsha bo ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his daughter-in-law.🔽This is his grandson.

original: de'i tsha bo'i chung ma ni 'di yin par shes so //
analyzed: de'i tsha bo'i chung ma ni 'di yin par shes so //
translated: This is his grandson’s wife.”

original: nye dgas thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas thos nas smras pa /

analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration of the vows, in terms of the actual basis of a downfall, the preparation, and the completion of a preparation.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam nyid du sngar ma 'thams par dge slong ma dang 'gron thabs cig tu zhugs shing tha mi dad par 'gro ba nyid ma gtogs par dge slong ma gcig dang yang lam
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i lam nyid du sngar ma 'thams par dge slong ma dang 'gron thabs cig tu zhugs shing tha mi dad par 'gro ba nyid ma gtogs par dge slong ma gcig dang yang lam
translated: The actual basis of a downfall is to travel on a road with a fully ordained nun, except if there are other people, if one has not previously agreed to travel with her, and if one does not proceed beyond an inhabited area.

original: las 'da' zhing 'gro na rgyang grags re rer dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'da' zhing 'gro na rgyang grags re rer dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one travels beyond an inhabited area on a road that is dangerous, one commits an actual downfall of the ascetic practices.

original: lam 'jigs pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lam 'jigs pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If one travels on a road that is not dangerous, there is no downfall.

original: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa gcig yan chad la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa gcig yan chad la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the nun is fully ordained, not degenerate, and there is more than one.

original: sngar 'thams pa la na smad pa med do //🔽lam gcig pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sngar 'thams pa la na smad pa med do // lam gcig pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if they are already related.🔽There is no offense if they are traveling on the same road.

original: rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if they go beyond the boundary of one earshot.

original: nyin mtshan gyi cha la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi cha la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if they travel during the day.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni lam 'jigs pa med pa dang / dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'thams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni lam 'jigs pa med pa dang / dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'thams pa'o //
translated: The agent in this case is a monk who is traveling on a road free of danger and who is related to a group of nuns.

original: 'di la yan lag sngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag sngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The factors are the same as in the root downfall.

original: lam 'jigs pa med pa nyid dang / dge slong ma gcig yan chad kyi 'gron pa dang / 'thams pa dang lam du zhugs pa dang / rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lam 'jigs pa med pa nyid dang / dge slong ma gcig yan chad kyi 'gron pa dang / 'thams pa dang lam du zhugs pa dang / rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: The monk is traveling on a road free of danger, with a group of nuns, one of whom is related to him, and they go beyond the boundary of one earshot.

original: @105a * // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci'i rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: @105a * // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci'i rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the act constitutes a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The preparatory stage of this downfall is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not reached the actual basis of the offense of traveling on the road together with a nun, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one engages in the actual basis, however many times one has engaged in the preparatory stages, there is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong ma ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma ma chags pa dang / nyams pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the nun is not lustful or has lost her lust, it is a minor infraction.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the person of a different gender is not fully ordained, it is a minor infraction.

original: rgyang grags kyi phyed du nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi phyed du nyes byas so //
translated: If it is less than half a krośa, it is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The preparatory stage of the preparatory stage is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many times as one engages in the preparatory stage, there are that many preparatory stages of the preparatory stage.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparatory stage of the preparatory stage is also a minor infraction, a minor infraction.

original: ltung ba med pa ni lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni lam 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one travels on a dangerous road.

original: ma 'thams pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma 'thams pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not touch.

original: lam tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lam tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the road is different.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one who is overwhelmed by pain, and for one whose mind is disturbed.🔽The training rule on the road

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //🔽dge slong dang dge slong ma 'gron lam du dro bas lam brgyags rin po che lnga 'am /🔽rin po cher smos pa lnga'am /
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o // dge slong dang dge slong ma 'gron lam du dro bas lam brgyags rin po che lnga 'am / rin po cher smos pa lnga'am /
translated: The monks should train in the rule, having downed the following: “‘I will not travel by appointment with a nun, except when there are dangers,’ this is how the training should be understood.”

original: bza' bar smos pa lnga las gang sbyor cing 'os pa bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar smos pa lnga las gang sbyor cing 'os pa bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk and a nun are traveling on a road, they should send a messenger to the other with one of five precious substances or one of five things that are said to be edible.🔽If they do not send a messenger, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: su dag gis bskur bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: su dag gis bskur bar bya zhe na /
translated: Who should send the messenger?

original: rtse rgod dang / rtse rgod mo dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul mo dag las gang yod pa dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtse rgod dang / rtse rgod mo dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul mo dag las gang yod pa dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: A monk should send a messenger to a nun, and a nun should send a messenger to a monk.

original: de dag med na dge slong ma rnams gcig gi lam brgyags gcig gis bskur du rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag med na dge slong ma rnams gcig gi lam brgyags gcig gis bskur du rung ngo //
translated: If they are not available, it is proper for the nuns to carry the provisions of one another.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gis gcig gi byin len yang bstabs su rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gis gcig gi byin len yang bstabs su rung ngo //
translated: It is proper for the monks and nuns to give and receive each other’s alms.

original: changs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: changs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abandon a sick fellow practitioner on the road.

original: lam du nad kyis btab pa de bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam du nad kyis btab pa de bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If one is afflicted by illness on the road, one should carry him.

original: dge slong ma la yang de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma la yang de bzhin du'o //
translated: The same applies to the nuns.

original: nad pa @105b bskur ba de la dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams phan tshun gcig gi grogs gcig gis bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa @105b bskur ba de la dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams phan tshun gcig gi grogs gcig gis bya'o //
translated: The monks and nuns should mutually assist each other in carrying the sick person.

original: mtshan mi mthun pas mgo logs nas bzung zhing mtshan mthun pas rkang pa logs nas bzung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pas mgo logs nas bzung zhing mtshan mthun pas rkang pa logs nas bzung ngo //
translated: One should carry the sick person by the head if one is of the opposite sex, and by the feet if one is of the same sex.

original: grong du phyin pa nyid na nad pa'i sman dang zan legs par sbyar te rang bzhin mthun pa'i nad g-yog gcig kyang bzhag nas bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa la song yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: grong du phyin pa nyid na nad pa'i sman dang zan legs par sbyar te rang bzhin mthun pa'i nad g-yog gcig kyang bzhag nas bsod snyoms pa la sogs pa la song yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one goes to a village and properly prepares medicine and food for the sick person, and leaves a nurse of compatible nature, there is no fault in going on alms round, etc.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽The twenty-sixth downfall is explained as follows:

original: dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung de nyi shu drug pa bshad zin to /🔽// / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung de nyi shu drug pa bshad zin to / // / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of traveling by boat with a fully ordained nun.🔽The bases of the downfall are twofold:

original: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bases of the downfall of traveling by boat with a fully ordained nun are twofold: those that are prohibited and those that are permitted.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The bases of the downfall that are prohibited are as follows: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' ltung bzed nag po can 'di dag ni rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ltung bzed nag po can 'di dag ni rkang pa spre'u zhag gis bskus te 'gro na yang 'gro bar chas pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed /
translated: “Nandaka and Upandaka, these black-bowl holders, smear their feet with monkey fat and then set out on their travels, and they obtain the offerings intended for those who are about to leave.

original: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: 'ong na yang glo bur du 'ongs pa'i rnyed pa sgrub par byed cing /
translated: When they return, they obtain the offerings intended for those who have just returned.

original: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They are liked by many people and are pleasing to them.”

original: yu bu cag ni khron pa'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong /
analyzed: yu bu cag ni khron pa'i rus sbal dang 'dra bar gar yang mi 'dong /
translated: “We are like the tortoise in the well. We don’t go anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang mi bas rnyed pa 'thob pa dang / skye bo mang po la dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar ga la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi bas rnyed pa 'thob pa dang / skye bo mang po la dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong bar ga la 'gyur gyi /
translated: How could we get any gain or be liked and pleasing to many people?

original: yu bu cag kyang grur zhugs te 'dong ngo zhes de dag dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du dong ste dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag lam brgyags sbyor du bcug nas de dag kyang khrid cing dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid de grur 'jug tu 'phags🔽so // de dag gis gang gi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du grur zhugs pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
analyzed: yu bu cag kyang grur zhugs te 'dong ngo zhes de dag dge slong ma'i dbyar khang du dong ste dge slong ma bcu gnyis sde dag lam brgyags sbyor du bcug nas de dag kyang khrid cing dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid de grur 'jug tu 'phags so // de dag gis gang gi tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du grur zhugs pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
translated: “We should also board a ship and go.” They went to the nuns’ rainy season retreat house and made the twelve nuns prepare provisions for the journey. They also took a monk who lived on alms.

original: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis 'khod par byas /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis 'khod par byas /
translated: When they were outside the boundary and had boarded the ship, they said, “Nandā and Nandabalā, for how long must we put up with the behavior of others?

original: tshur sheg bdag cag rang rang gi spyod lam gyis 'khod par bya'o zhes dang por dga' bo 'dug nas /
analyzed: tshur sheg bdag cag rang rang gi spyod lam gyis 'khod par bya'o zhes dang por dga' bo 'dug nas /
translated: Come, let us put up with our own behavior.” First Nandā sat down.

original: de'i 'og tu dga' mo 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i lhan cig gnas pa @106a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dga' mo 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i lhan cig gnas pa 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i lhan cig gnas pa @106a * //
translated: After that, Nanda’s companion was seated.🔽After that, Nanda’s novice monk was seated.

original: 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i dge tshul 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i dge tshul 'dug go //
analyzed: 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' bo'i dge tshul 'dug / de'i 'og tu dga' mo'i dge tshul 'dug go //
translated: After that, Nanda’s novice nun was seated.

original: de bzhin du nye dga' bo dang gtsug dga' mo la sogs pa yang spel mar bkod de dong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nye dga' bo dang gtsug dga' mo la sogs pa yang spel mar bkod de dong ngo //
translated: In the same way, Upananda, Upaśānta, and so on were also seated in turn.

original: don mthun de dang bram ze zhig lhan cig 'gro ba de sa di dag mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: don mthun de dang bram ze zhig lhan cig 'gro ba de sa di dag mthong nas smras pa /
translated: A certain brahmin who was traveling with the caravan saw this and said,

original: 'di ni dge sbyong yin /
analyzed: 'di ni dge sbyong yin /
translated: “This is a śramaṇa.

original: de'i chung ma ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i chung ma ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his wife.

original: de'i bu ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i bu ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his son.

original: de'i mna' ma ni 'di yin /🔽de'i tsha bo ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de'i mna' ma ni 'di yin / de'i tsha bo ni 'di yin /
translated: This is his daughter-in-law.🔽This is his nephew.

original: de'i tsha bo ni chung ma ni 'di yin par shes so //
analyzed: de'i tsha bo ni chung ma ni 'di yin par shes so //
translated: This is his nephew’s wife.”

original: nye dgas thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas thos nas smras pa /
translated: Upananda heard this and said,

original: bkren pa khyod kyi gnya' bar rdog pas mnan nas de ltar yin no //
analyzed: bkren pa khyod kyi gnya' bar rdog pas mnan nas de ltar yin no //
translated: “You poor thing, I’m stepping on your neck like that.”

original: bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
translated: The alms-begging monk thought,🔽“

original: bdag shi ba ni bla'i gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di dag dang / lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'gro ba ni mi rung ngo snyam nas de phyir log ste /
analyzed: bdag shi ba ni bla'i gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di dag dang / lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'gro ba ni mi rung ngo snyam nas de phyir log ste /
translated: “It would be better for me to die than to travel with these people who engage in bad behavior.”🔽He returned and went to Jetavana, where he related the events to the monks.🔽A number of monks with minimal concerns criticized him, saying, “Why do monks travel with a group of nuns?”

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas des skabs de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas grur 'jug par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas des skabs de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas grur 'jug par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They disparaged him,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread the word.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One then assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”🔽“It is, O Blessed One.”🔽The Blessed One rebuked them,🔽“Foolish men, this is not fitting for ascetics,🔽it is not allowable,🔽it is not proper,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not pure,🔽it is not to be done.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: It is not the duty of one who has gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “Therefore, the training should be given in this way:

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong gang dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong gang dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas /
translated: ‘If a monk travels by boat together with a group of nuns,

original: gru gcig tu 'jug cing gyen du 'gro 'am thur du 'gron lhung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: gru gcig tu 'jug cing gyen du 'gro 'am thur du 'gron lhung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: going upstream or downstream, and he stands up and says, “Nuns, move the boat!”

original: yul ni mnyan yod gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The location was Śrāvastī. The person was six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhe na /
translated: The affliction was desire.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong ma'i don mthun dang 'thams nas gru @106b gcig tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong ma'i don mthun dang 'thams nas gru @106b gcig tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The misdeed was traveling by boat together with a group of nuns.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction is this: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis chu klung gnas can gyi phyi rol tha ba can gyi kun dga' ra bar dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis chu klung gnas can gyi phyi rol tha ba can gyi kun dga' ra bar dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang byed du bcug nas /
translated: At that time, a certain householder had a monastery built for the Saṅgha outside the town of Sthūlakoṣṭhaka on the bank of the river.

original: des gtsug lag khang de dbul ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i dge 'dun spyan drangs so //
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang de dbul ba'i phyir gnyi ga'i dge 'dun spyan drangs so //
translated: In order to dedicate that monastery, he invited the Saṅgha of both the monks and nuns.

original: dge slong ma zhig dge ba'i phyogs la brtson par gyur pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma zhig dge ba'i phyogs la brtson par gyur pa des bsams pa /
translated: A certain nun who was devoted to virtue thought,

original: deng bdag gis bsod snyoms la rgyu ma dgos pas ji srid du gdugs tshod la nya bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron bya zhing /
analyzed: deng bdag gis bsod snyoms la rgyu ma dgos pas ji srid du gdugs tshod la nya bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron bya zhing /
translated: “Today I do not need to go out for alms. As long as it is not noon, I will devote myself to virtue.

original: de'i 'og tu dus shes par byas te 'gro'o snyam nas des ji srid du gdugs tshod la nye bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dus shes par byas te 'gro'o snyam nas des ji srid du gdugs tshod la nye bar ma gyur pa de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas /
translated: Then, thinking, “I will go after I know the time,” she practiced virtue until it was almost noon.

original: de'i 'og tu dus shes par byas te chu klung gi 'gram du song ba dang / ji tsam na dge slong dag grur zhugs nas gru pas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dus shes par byas te chu klung gi 'gram du song ba dang / ji tsam na dge slong dag grur zhugs nas gru pas smras pa /
translated: Then, knowing the time, she went to the riverbank, where she saw monks boarding a boat. The boatman said,🔽“Noble lady, board the boat.”

original: 'phags ma grur zhugs shig / dge slong ma des smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags ma grur zhugs shig / dge slong ma des smras pa /
translated: The nun said,

original: bzhin bzangs je song shig dang gru gzhan bkang ba na 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs je song shig dang gru gzhan bkang ba na 'gro'o //
translated: “Sir, go away. I will go when the boat is full.”

original: gru pa des yang dang yang du 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: gru pa des yang dang yang du 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: The boatman came again and again and said,🔽“Noble lady, board the boat.”

original: 'phags ma grur zhugs shig / des kyang smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags ma grur zhugs shig / des kyang smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: bzhin bzangs je song shig dang / gru gzhan bkang ba na 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs je song shig dang / gru gzhan bkang ba na 'gro'o //
translated: “Sir, go away. I will go when the boat is full.”

original: gru pa de song nas chu klung gi phyi rol du gru phur pa la brtod de skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyi nang du zhugs shing 'dug go //
analyzed: gru pa de song nas chu klung gi phyi rol du gru phur pa la brtod de skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyi nang du zhugs shing 'dug go //
translated: The boatman went away, tied the boat to a stake on the other side of the river, and sat down in the middle of a crowd of people.

original: dge slong ma des yang dang yang du bos pa dang / gru pa des tshig kyang ma ster nas de de na sdod stong nas ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas de'i 'og tu dbyar khang du phyir log ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma des yang dang yang du bos pa dang / gru pa des tshig kyang ma ster nas de de na sdod stong nas ji tsam na gdugs tshod yol nas de'i 'og tu dbyar khang du phyir log ste /
translated: The nun called to him again and again, but the boatman did not respond. She stayed there until noon, and then returned to the rainy season retreat.

original: de ji srid du lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas /🔽gang gi tshe lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong ma rnams lhags te de la smras pa /
analyzed: de ji srid du lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid kyi bar du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas / gang gi tshe lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong ma rnams lhags te de la smras pa /
translated: As long as her body did not lose its luster, she continued to practice virtue.🔽But when her body lost its luster, she lay down to rest.

original: 'phags ma gal te zas gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin snyam mam ci byas /
analyzed: 'phags ma gal te zas gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin snyam mam ci byas /
translated: The nuns came and said to her, “Noble lady, if the food is someone else’s, do you think the stomach is someone else’s too?”

original: ci tsam gyis glos phab ste nyal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis zas zos so //
analyzed: ci tsam gyis glos phab ste nyal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis zas zos so //
translated: “How is it that you have lain down to rest just as you finished eating?”🔽“Who ate?”

original: sus zos / khyod kyis so //
analyzed: sus zos / khyod kyis so //
translated: “You.”

original: @107a * // kho mos ma zos so //
analyzed: @107a * // kho mos ma zos so //
translated: “I did not eat.”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir glos phab ste nyal /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir glos phab ste nyal /
translated: “Well then, why did you lie down to rest?”

original: des skabs de rgyas par dge slong ma rnams la brjod nas dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod do //
analyzed: des skabs de rgyas par dge slong ma rnams la brjod nas dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod do //
translated: She told the nuns in detail what had happened, and the nuns told the monks in detail.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs so //
translated: “Monks, that being the case, I rescind the rule that one should not go directly to the other side.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: spoke in a way that accorded with, was consistent with, and appropriate to the praise of the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, and said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na lnga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na lnga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, that being the case, I rescind the rule that one should not go directly to the other side, and I allow going directly to the other side.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this basis of training for the Vinaya:

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas gru gcig tu 'jug cing gyen du 'gro 'am thur du 'gro na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs te lhung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig 'thams nas gru gcig tu 'jug cing gyen du 'gro 'am thur du 'gro na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs te lhung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: “If any monk, traveling together with a group of nuns, boards a boat with them, whether going upstream or downstream, except to cross to the other side, he commits a downfall requiring confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma /
translated: The person is a monk of this Dharma, a nun,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //🔽de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do // de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am /
translated: and there is no affliction or fault.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, “if any monk” means the group of six or anyone like them.

original: dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i don mthun dang lhan cig ces bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “Traveling together with a group of nuns” means with those of this Dharma.

original: 'thams nas zhes bya ba ni brda byas nas so //
analyzed: 'thams nas zhes bya ba ni brda byas nas so //
translated: “Boards a boat” means to make an agreement.

original: gru gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shog ma gcig pa dang / la gcan gcig pa dang / gru btsas gcig par ro //
analyzed: gru gcig tu zhes bya ba ni shog ma gcig pa dang / la gcan gcig pa dang / gru btsas gcig par ro //
translated: “In the same boat” means on the same raft, on the same float, on the same log.

original: 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni zhon cing ngo //🔽gyen du 'gro 'am zhes bya ba ni rgyun las bzlog phyogs su 'gro na 'o //
analyzed: 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni zhon cing ngo // gyen du 'gro 'am zhes bya ba ni rgyun las bzlog phyogs su 'gro na 'o //
translated: “To board” means to get on.🔽“To go upstream” means to go against the current.

original: thur du 'gron zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyogs su 'gro na 'o //
analyzed: thur du 'gron zhes bya ba ni rgyun phyogs su 'gro na 'o //
translated: “To go downstream” means to go with the current.

original: thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba gzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except for going straight across” means except for going straight across.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “One commits an offense” is as above.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba @107b med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba @107b med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the offense through the main part, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the offense, the non-offense, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma gtogs par 'thams nas dge slong ma gcig dang yang cig car gru gcig gis lam las 'das zhing 'gro na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid ma gtogs par 'thams nas dge slong ma gcig dang yang cig car gru gcig gis lam las 'das zhing 'gro na thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba ma gtogs
translated: Here, the basic downfall is defined as follows:🔽Unless both banks are dangerous, if a fully ordained monk travels by boat on the same river as a fully ordained nun, and they cross over to the opposite bank at the same time,

original: te rgyang grags re rer dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te rgyang grags re rer dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then, except for going directly to the other shore, for every krośa he travels with the nun in the boat, he commits a basic downfall of the monks’ code.

original: 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If both banks are safe, there is no fault.

original: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa gcig yan chad la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa gcig yan chad la na smad pa med do //
translated: If there is one fully ordained nun or more, and she is not impaired, there is no fault.

original: sngar 'thams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sngar 'thams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If they cross over together because they were already on the boat, there is no fault.

original: gru tshugs sho gam gcig pa dang / la gcan gcig pa dang / gru btsas gcig pa'i gru tha dad pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gru tshugs sho gam gcig pa dang / la gcan gcig pa dang / gru btsas gcig pa'i gru tha dad pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the boats are different, but they have the same port of departure, the same customs inspection, and the same toll for crossing, there is no fault.

original: gyen du 'gro yang rung thur du 'gro yang rung ste rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gyen du 'gro yang rung thur du 'gro yang rung ste rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Whether going upstream or downstream, there is no offense if one goes beyond the range of one krosa.

original: nyin mtshan gyi cha la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi cha la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes beyond the range of one day and night.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa dang / dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'thams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa dang / dge slong ma'i 'gron pa dang 'thams pa'o //
translated: The agent of this is one who is not afraid of the two banks and who is accompanied by a group of nuns.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the basic downfall occurs through ten factors.

original: 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa nyid dang / dge slong ma gcig yan chad kyi 'gron pa dang 'thams pa dang / grur zhugs pa dang / rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa med pa nyid dang / dge slong ma gcig yan chad kyi 'gron pa dang 'thams pa dang / grur zhugs pa dang / rgyang grags gcig gi mtha' las 'das pa'o //
translated: Not being afraid of the two banks, being accompanied by a group of nuns of more than one, boarding a boat, and going beyond the range of one krosa.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those factors are incomplete, there is an offense according to the circumstances.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the offense of boarding a boat with a nun, but has not reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽dge slong ma ma chags pa dang nyams pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // dge slong ma ma chags pa dang nyams pa la nyes byas so //
translated: For each of the various preparations that are different, there is one misdeed.🔽For a non-attached or impaired fully ordained nun, it is a misdeed.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: For one with an incompatible gender, it is a misdeed.

original: rgyang grags kyi phyed du nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi phyed du nyes byas so //
translated: For half a krośa, it is a misdeed.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: For as many preparations, there are that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni 'gram gnyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if both banks are dangerous.

original: ma 'thams pa la ltung ba med do //🔽gru tshugs sho gam tha dad pa @108a * //
analyzed: ma 'thams pa la ltung ba med do // gru tshugs sho gam tha dad pa @108a * //
translated: There is no offense if there is no contact.🔽There is no offense if the ferry, the toll,

original: dang / lag can tha dad pa dang / gru btsas tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dang / lag can tha dad pa dang / gru btsas tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: and the fare are different.

original: thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba la ltung ba med do //🔽thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba de'i phyir zhugs pa na chu'i gzhung yo ba dang / chu klung gis gtib chad pa dang / dba' klong las gzur ba'i dbang dang ru skya dad gdos pa chag pa'i dbang dang ru skya 'dzin pa'i dbang gis rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba la ltung ba med do // thad kar pha rol du 'gro ba de'i phyir zhugs pa na chu'i gzhung yo ba dang / chu klung gis gtib chad pa dang / dba' klong las gzur ba'i dbang dang ru skya dad gdos pa chag pa'i dbang dang ru skya 'dzin pa'i dbang gis rgyun las bzlog pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: There is no offense if one goes directly to the other shore.

original: rgyun phyogs kyi 'jug pa gzhan du song ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs kyi 'jug pa gzhan du song ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one enters a river to go directly to the other shore, there is no offense if one is carried by the current to a different place because of the force of the current, the force of the wind, or the force of a boat.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or in a dream, or if one is in pain due to a severe illness.🔽The training rule on boats is finished.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule on the rainy season

original: gru tshugs kyi sho gam dang la gcan dang gru btsas gcig gam tha dad pa brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gru tshugs kyi sho gam dang la gcan dang gru btsas gcig gam tha dad pa brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate whether the port fees, the toll for crossing the mountain pass, and the ferry fees are the same or different.

original: 'gram gnyis las gcig 'jigs pa yod la gcig 'jigs pa med na /
analyzed: 'gram gnyis las gcig 'jigs pa yod la gcig 'jigs pa med na /
translated: If there is danger in one of the two banks and there is no danger in the other,

original: gang na 'jigs pa med pa der gzur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang na 'jigs pa med pa der gzur bar bya'o //
translated: one should stay in the place where there is no danger.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽The twenty-seventh downfall is explained:

original: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bdun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bdun pa bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of traveling in a boat with a nun.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Vinaya Verses:

original: bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The twenty-fifth section.

original: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //

analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /

analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense, and the application is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni sgo gang na 'dug pa dang / sman 'thag tu 'jug pa dang / sgom bcad par 'dug pa dang / gzhan dag 'jug cing gzhan dag 'byung ba la ltung ba med do //
