translated: There is no offense if one is staying in a place with a door, or if one is having medicine woven, or if one is staying in a place with a door that is closed, or if others are entering and others are leaving.

analyzed: skyabs lnga po dag gis ma bskyabs pa la ltung ba med do //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or if one is insane, or if one’s mind is disturbed, or if one is in extreme pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //

translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying in any way on staying alone in any place at any time.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gcig pu 'dug pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu brgyad pa bshad zin to /

original: // / gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /

translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.🔽When Bhadrā had gone forth, she was the caretaker of the monastery.🔽When the nuns put on their lower and upper robes in the morning,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka yang snga dro sham thabs bgos /

analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te / mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas /

analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ga la ba der song ngo //

analyzed: sbed ma khyod kyis bdag cag gnyis skyed mos tshal dang / @110b 'dun sa dang lha'i gnas ga ge mo zhig tu bca' ba 'di dang 'di lta bu 'chos pa dang / bza' ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zos pa dang / btung ba 'di dang 'di lta bu 'thungs pa dang gnas mal 'di dang 'di lta bu bshams pa dang /
translated: “Concealed, do you remember when we two were in a park, a meeting hall, or a certain divine place, when we prepared such and such food, when we ate such and such food, when we drank such and such drinks, when we set up such and such bedding,

analyzed: 'bru mar gyi mar me 'di dang 'di lta bu btsugs shing der bdag cag gnyis kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu byas pa dran nam /

analyzed: sbed mas smras pa dran no //

analyzed: de na dge slong ma rgan mo nad pa zhig 'dug nas des bsams pa /

analyzed: sbed ma khyod kyis ci byas nas dbyar khang 'di kho na bzhin du phyag dar dang bcas par 'dug / sbed mas smras pa /

analyzed: phu nu mo dag gang tshun chad nas khyed cag bsod snyoms la dong ba de tshun chad nas kho mo ma 'dug go //

translated: When the old sick nun heard that, she told the nuns in detail what had happened, and the nuns said, “Why do the monks stand alone with the nuns in private and concealed places?”

analyzed: phyar ka gtong par byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

translated: Having seen the ten benefits, the Buddha laid down the rule for training in the Vinaya:🔽“If any monk stands alone with a nun in a private, concealed place, he commits an offense.

analyzed: gcig pu gcig dang zhes bya ba ni de de dang ngo //

analyzed: 'greng na zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang na 'greng na'o //

translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restorations should be understood through the main part and the preparatory and subsequent stages of the downfalls.

translated: The difference is that in the former, the word “woman” is used, while here the word “nun” is used, and in the former, the word “sitting” is used, while here the word “standing” is used.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong ma khyim so bzung ba'am ma bzung ba mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten nus pa gcig dang / skye bo'i rgyun lugs med pa nyid kyis phyogs dben pa nyid dang /
translated: and who is in a secluded place because there is no one around,🔽and who is in a place where there is a refuge,

analyzed: chos 'di pa'i dge slong ma khyim so bzung ba 'am ma bzung ba mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten nus pa bsnyen par @111b rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: A fully ordained nun of this doctrine who has taken up the life of a householder or who has not taken it up, who is capable of engaging in sexual intercourse, who is fully ordained, who has not lost her status, and who is not despised,

original: dge slong ma gcig pu nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma gcig pu nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: and who is alone, and who is not despised,

original: skye bo'i rgyun lugs med pa nyid kyis phyogs dben ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: skye bo'i rgyun lugs med pa nyid kyis phyogs dben ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: and who is in a secluded place because there is no one around, and who is not despised,

original: skyabs lnga po rtsig pas bskyabs pa dang / rib mas bskyabs pa dang / yol bas bskyabs pa dang / thibs pos bskyabs pa dang / mtshan mos bskyabs pa nyid la na smad pa med do //

translated: There is no offense if the five shelters are a wall, a curtain, a screen, a thicket, or darkness.

original: bar 'dom gang nyid dang / de bas nye ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bar 'dom gang nyid dang / de bas nye ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the distance is an arm’s length or less.

original: gnyi ga 'greng ste sdod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'greng ste sdod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if both are standing.

translated: The following are the factors that make this action a serious offense: the monk is standing, the nun is alone, there is no other man present, the place is secluded, there is a shelter, and the distance is an arm’s length or less.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

translated: at a distance of an arm’s length,

original: gnyi ga 'greng ste sdod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'greng ste sdod pa'o //
translated: and who stands while he sits,

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par ba smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par ba smad do //
translated: if any of these factors are incomplete, then the downfall is a serious transgression, a minor offense, or a downfall that is a remainder.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du gcig pu 'greng ste sdod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //

translated: nor did I station any guards. What is the cause of this excellent harvest?” He looked around and saw human footprints. Following them, he went to the hut and saw a monk who was practicing mendicancy sitting cross-legged.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: 'di'i mthus zhing 'di shin tu lo tog phun sum tshogs par gyur to snyam nas des smras pa /
analyzed: 'di'i mthus zhing 'di shin tu lo tog phun sum tshogs par gyur to snyam nas des smras pa /
translated: “By his power this field has an excellent harvest.” He said,

original: 'phags pa spyil bu 'di na bzhugs sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyil bu 'di na bzhugs sam /
translated: “Noble one, do you live in this hut?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: khyim bdag yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag yin no //
translated: “Householder, I do.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,🔽“

original: 'phags pa zhing 'di bdag gi lags kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhing 'di bdag gi lags kyi /
translated: Noble one, this field belongs to me.

original: 'phags pas me tog dang 'bras bu dang tshems shing dag ji bder longs spyad du gsol /
analyzed: 'phags pas me tog dang 'bras bu dang tshems shing dag ji bder longs spyad du gsol /
translated: Noble one, please enjoy the flowers, fruits, and tooth cleaners as you like.

original: 'phags pa sang bdag gi sdum par bsod snyoms gsol bar ci gnang zhes mgron du bos nas de khyim du song ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sang bdag gi sdum par bsod snyoms gsol bar ci gnang zhes mgron du bos nas de khyim du song ste /
translated: After inviting him to be a guest, he went home, thinking, Tomorrow, I will offer him alms in my house.

original: chung mas zas gtsang zhing bsod pa dag sta gon byed du bcug go //
analyzed: chung mas zas gtsang zhing bsod pa dag sta gon byed du bcug go //
translated: His wife prepared pure and delicious food.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong ma sbom dga' mo snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong ma sbom dga' mo snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: At that time, the nun Chudapanthaka put on her lower robe,🔽took her alms bowl and Dharma robes, and entered Shravasti to collect alms.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas de mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs te smras pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas de mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs te smras pa /
translated: As she was wandering for alms, she entered that house and said,

original: mtshan bzangs aa rog gya bsod snyoms byin cig khyim bdag gi chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: mtshan bzangs aa rog gya bsod snyoms byin cig khyim bdag gi chung mas smras pa /
translated: Good features, give me alms. The householder's wife said,

original: 'phags ma bdag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig spyan drangs pa de mchis te /
analyzed: 'phags ma bdag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig spyan drangs pa de mchis te /
translated: Noble one, I have invited an alms-goer. He has come.

original: zan bcad par gyur na mi rung bas bdag bral gyi re zhig bzhud cig / sbom dga' mos smras pa /
analyzed: zan bcad par gyur na mi rung bas bdag bral gyi re zhig bzhud cig / sbom dga' mos smras pa /
translated: It would not be right to fast, so I will go for a while.🔽 Pramudita said,

original: gal te kho mos bsod snyom pa de khrid de 'ongs na khyod kyis kho mo la bsod snyoms sbyin nam /
analyzed: gal te kho mos bsod snyom pa de khrid de 'ongs na khyod kyis kho mo la bsod snyoms sbyin nam /
translated: If I bring that alms-goer, will you give me alms?

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽I will give them to you.

original: gsol lo // sbom dga' mos bsam pa /
analyzed: gsol lo // sbom dga' mos bsam pa /
translated: Pramudita thought,🔽Since the other monks go out for alms and return so late, that alms-goer must be the one who enters last.

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis bsod snyom la rgyus nas de tsam phyir 'byung bas @115b gang gzod 'jug pa de bsod snyoms pa yin no snyam nas de grong khyer gyi sgor song ste bsdad do //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis bsod snyom la rgyus nas de tsam phyir 'byung bas @115b gang gzod 'jug pa de bsod snyoms pa yin no snyam nas de grong khyer gyi sgor song ste bsdad do //
translated: She went to the city gate and waited.

original: bsod snyoms pa des kyang bsams pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa des kyang bsams pa /
translated: The alms-goer also thought,🔽Today I do not need to go out for alms, so I will do virtuous activities and go out at the right time.🔽 He put on his lower robe and said,

original: deng bdag gis bsod snyoms la rgyu mi dgos pas dge ba'i phyogs la tron bya zhing dus shes par bya te 'gro'o snyam nas des dus shes par byas nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: deng bdag gis bsod snyoms la rgyu mi dgos pas dge ba'i phyogs la tron bya zhing dus shes par bya te 'gro'o snyam nas des dus shes par byas nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: I will go out for alms.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la 'jug par brtsams pa dang / de sbom dga' mos mthong nas bsams pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la 'jug par brtsams pa dang / de sbom dga' mos mthong nas bsams pa /
translated: Utpala­prabhā saw him and thought,🔽“This is the alms-collector.”

original: bsod snyoms pa de 'di yin no snyam nas de la dris pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de 'di yin no snyam nas de la dris pa /
translated: She asked him,

original: 'phags pa sdum pa ga ge mo zhig tu spyan ma drangs sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdum pa ga ge mo zhig tu spyan ma drangs sam /
translated: “Noble one, weren’t you invited to such-and-such a house?”

original: srid mo g-yar drangs so /
analyzed: srid mo g-yar drangs so /
translated: “Sister, I was invited.”

original: 'phags pa bdag gis khyod kyi khyim der khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gis khyod kyi khyim der khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: “Noble one, I praised you in that house.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: sring mo ci kho bos khyod la kho bo'i bsngags pa rjod cig ces byas sam /
analyzed: sring mo ci kho bos khyod la kho bo'i bsngags pa rjod cig ces byas sam /
translated: “Sister, did I ask you to praise me?”

original: 'phags pa bka' ma stsal to //
analyzed: 'phags pa bka' ma stsal to //
translated: “Noble one, you didn’t say anything.”

original: bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
translated: The alms-collector thought,

original: 'di ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i zas yin par gyur gyi bdag gi zan bcad pa ni bla'i bdag ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas des phyir ldog par brtsams pa dang / sbom dga' mos smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i zas yin par gyur gyi bdag gi zan bcad pa ni bla'i bdag ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas des phyir ldog par brtsams pa dang / sbom dga' mos smras pa /
translated: “This is food that has been prepared by a nun. It would be better for me to fast than for me to be tainted by a downfall.” He turned back,🔽and Utpala­prabhā said,

original: 'phags pa bdag gi khyod kyi gdung yang ma 'tshal mtshan yang ma 'tshal bas bdag gis khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod re skan /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gi khyod kyi gdung yang ma 'tshal mtshan yang ma 'tshal bas bdag gis khyod kyi bsngags pa brjod re skan /
translated: Noble one, I do not know your lineage or your name, so I cannot praise you.

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
translated: The alms-goer said:

original: sring mo gal te khyod kyi tshig snga ma bden na ni phyi ma brdzun la /
analyzed: sring mo gal te khyod kyi tshig snga ma bden na ni phyi ma brdzun la /
translated: Sister, if your earlier words are true, the later ones are false,🔽and if the later ones are true, the earlier ones are false. He turned back and went to his hut.

original: gal te phyi ma bden na ni snga ma brdzun no zhes de phyir log ste spyil bu de nyid du song nas de ji srid du lus las mad ngas ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe lus las mad ngas
analyzed: gal te phyi ma bden na ni snga ma brdzun no zhes de phyir log ste spyil bu de nyid du song nas de ji srid du lus las mad ngas ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe lus las mad ngas
translated: As long as the heat of his body did not subside, he engaged in virtue. When the heat of his body did subside, he lay down on his side.

original: yal ba de'i tshe na glos pha ba ste nyal ba dang / bsod snyoms pa gzhan dag 'ongs te de la smras pa /
analyzed: yal ba de'i tshe na glos pha ba ste nyal ba dang / bsod snyoms pa gzhan dag 'ongs te de la smras pa /
translated: Other alms-goers came and said to him:

original: gal te zas gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin snyam mam /
analyzed: gal te zas gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin snyam mam /
translated: If the food is another's, do you think the belly is also another's?

original: ji tsam gyis glos phab ste nyal bar 'gyur ba de tsam gyis zas zos so //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis glos phab ste nyal bar 'gyur ba de tsam gyis zas zos so //
translated: He ate as much as it took to lie down on his side.

original: sus zos / khyod kyis zos so //
analyzed: sus zos / khyod kyis zos so //
translated: Who ate? You ate.

original: kho bos ma zos so //
analyzed: kho bos ma zos so //
translated: “I didn’t eat it.”

original: 'o na ci'i phyir glos phab ste nyal /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir glos phab ste nyal /
translated: “Well then, why did you lie down?”

original: des skabs de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des skabs de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monk explained the situation to the other monks, who in turn told the Blessed One. The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs so //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bsla @116a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs so // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bsla @116a * //
translated: “Therefore, I allow you to eat food that has been invited beforehand.”

original: pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, gave a teaching on what is consistent with that, what is in accord with that, and what is in harmony with that.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He then said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous allowance was a concession,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: but this is the rule.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i zas za na sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i zas za na sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk, knowingly, eats food that a nun has prepared, except if invited to a house, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong bsod snyoms pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong bsod snyoms pa /
translated: The person was a monk who went for alms.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis rig pa 'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyis rig pa 'am /
translated: As for “a monk,” it refers to the group of six or anyone else like them.

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: “Knowingly” means not being aware through sleep or being told by others.

original: dge slong mas zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: dge slong mas zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “A nun” means someone belonging to this teaching.

original: sbyor du bcug pa'i zhes bya ba ni sbyor du bcug pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor du bcug pa'i zhes bya ba ni sbyor du bcug pa gnyis te /
translated: “Prepared” means prepared in two ways:

original: tshul khrims kyis sbyor du bcug pa dang / thos pas sbyor du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis sbyor du bcug pa dang / thos pas sbyor du bcug pa'o //
translated: prepared through morality and prepared through learning.

original: zas zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang / bza' ba lnga'o //
analyzed: zas zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga dang / bza' ba lnga'o //
translated: “Food” means the five cooked foods and the five non-cooked foods.

original: zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du med na'o //
analyzed: zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du med na'o //
translated: “Meal” means when it is not swallowed.

original: sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni sngar khyim du mgron du bos pa bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: sngar khyim du bos pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni sngar khyim du mgron du bos pa bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except when invited to a home” means except when invited to a home.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means a serious offense, as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the offense, the non-offense, the training, and the amendment should be understood through the basic offense, the preparatory act, and the act that completes the preparatory act.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du ma bos pa la dge slong mas yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas sbyor du bcug pa dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du ma bos pa la dge slong mas yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas sbyor du bcug pa dang /
translated: Here, the basic offense is when a layperson who has not invited a monk to a home has a nun who does not have good qualities cause him to prepare food with verbal informative form.

original: bos pa la yang dge slong mas yon tan yang dag ba ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas lhag pa sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos na dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed🔽kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bos pa la yang dge slong mas yon tan yang dag ba ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas lhag pa sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos na dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, if a monk is invited by a nun who is not a true spiritual being, and she causes him to obtain food by means of verbal expression, and the monk eats it perceiving it as such, then he commits the offense of eating food obtained by a nun.

original: sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du bos pa la dge slong mas tshul @116b khrims dang / thos pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du bos pa la dge slong mas tshul @116b khrims dang / thos pa dang / de gnyis kyi 'bras bu rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang /
translated: If a patron invites a monk to a meal, and a nun who is not a true spiritual being causes him to obtain food by means of verbal expression, such as, “The one who has ethical discipline, learning, the fruits of those two, stream enterer, once returner, nonreturner, and arhat,

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i yon tan gang yang rung ba dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa'i yon tan gang yang rung ba dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: or who is a holder of the sūtras, a holder of the vinaya, or a holder of the mātṛkā is invited,” then there is no offense for the monk to eat it perceiving it as such.

original: sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du bos pa la dge slong mas yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas lhag pa sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos pa la na smad pa med
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis dge slong mgron du bos pa la dge slong mas yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gis ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis zas lhag pa sbyor du bcug pa dge slong gis der 'du shes pas zos pa la na smad pa med
translated: There is no offense if the patron invites the monks and the nun causes the leftover food to be given by means of speech that is not completely pure, and the monk eats it, perceiving it as such.

original: do // sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro ba pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa ma yin pa skyes pa nyid dam bud med nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: do // sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro ba pa khyim par gyur pa srog dang ldan pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa ma yin pa skyes pa nyid dam bud med nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the patron is a human being, a layperson, alive, not a neuter, not a hermaphrodite, a man or a woman.

original: dge slong mgron du ma bos pa dang bos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong mgron du ma bos pa dang bos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not invited or is invited.

original: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can mnyams pa nye du dang nye du ma yin pas sbyor du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa can mnyams pa nye du dang nye du ma yin pas sbyor du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the nun is fully ordained, and the food is given by a relative or a non-relative.

original: yon tan dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad dang / sde snod gsum dang ldan pa gang yang rung ba dag gis yang dag pa ma yin pas sbyor du bcug pa pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: yon tan dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / de dag gi 'bras bu 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad dang / sde snod gsum dang ldan pa gang yang rung ba dag gis yang dag pa ma yin pas sbyor du bcug pa pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in those who are endowed with qualities, ethics, learning, and the eight noble persons who are the fruits of those, or any of the three baskets, engaging in sex with those who are not their spouses.

original: tshig gis bcol zhing ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis sbyor du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: tshig gis bcol zhing ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis sbyor du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in engaging in sex through verbal communication and verbal informative form.

original: zas bza' bar bya ba lnga dang / bca' bar bya ba lnga gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas bza' bar bya ba lnga dang / bca' bar bya ba lnga gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating any of the five foods to be eaten and the five foods to be chewed.

original: zas lhag ma gsum 'phel ba las rtsad byed dang / ra mar las ba mar dang / 'gyur byed kyi lan tshva las rgyam tshal sogs pa dang / rtsa ba mo las dar ba dang / tsha dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las tshogs la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: zas lhag ma gsum 'phel ba las rtsad byed dang / ra mar las ba mar dang / 'gyur byed kyi lan tshva las rgyam tshal sogs pa dang / rtsa ba mo las dar ba dang / tsha dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las tshogs la sogs pa dang /
translated: There is no fault in increasing the three remaining foods: from the increase of roots, tubers, and stems, from curd comes butter, from fermented grain mash comes beer, from the root of the sweet flag comes ginger, and from a drink mixed with salt comes a drink for the assembly.

original: mon sran gre'u'i khur ba las hvags kyi khur ba la sogs pa dang / tsha skyur las sdo sha la sogs pa dang / bu ram chu las hvags chu la sogs pa dang / 'bras chen rtsub mo dang / ko dra ba'i chan las 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang /
analyzed: mon sran gre'u'i khur ba las hvags kyi khur ba la sogs pa dang / tsha skyur las sdo sha la sogs pa dang / bu ram chu las hvags chu la sogs pa dang / 'bras chen rtsub mo dang / ko dra ba'i chan las 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang /
translated: It is not a downfall to eat food that has been prepared by a nun, such as a cake prepared by a nun instead of a pea soup, or a meat dish instead of sour soup, or a grape drink instead of molasses water, or coarse rice instead of rice with kodrava grain, or rice with barley instead of rice with lentils,

original: mon sran gre'u'i sran tshod las mon sran sde'u'i sran chod dang / sdo tshod las sha rnam pa sna tshogs dang / hvags tshod dang zho dang 'o ma'i tshan la sogs pa lta bur lhag par sbyor du bcug pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //🔽zas @117a * //🔽kyang dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mon sran gre'u'i sran tshod las mon sran sde'u'i sran chod dang / sdo tshod las sha rnam pa sna tshogs dang / hvags tshod dang zho dang 'o ma'i tshan la sogs pa lta bur lhag par sbyor du bcug pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do // zas @117a * // kyang dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid yin la /
translated: or a lentil soup instead of a pea soup, or various kinds of meat instead of a bean soup, or a grape soup, or curd, or milk, or buttermilk, and so on.

original: dge slong gis kyang der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall to eat food prepared by a nun if the monk did not know it was prepared by a nun.🔽It is not a downfall if the monk perceives it as prepared by someone else, or is unsure of it.

original: zos te mgul du mid pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: zos te mgul du mid pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a downfall if the monk eats the food and then swallows it.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is the nun who instigates the invitation, and the perception of the invitation is the primary agent.

original: 'di la dge slong mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang bos pa gnyi ga la yan lag drug drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽mgron du ma bos pa la ni mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang / dge slong mas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang / dag gi rnam par rig byed dang / zas sbyor du bcug pa dang / dge slong gis der 'du shes pa dang zas zos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dge slong mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang bos pa gnyi ga la yan lag drug drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / mgron du ma bos pa la ni mgron du ma bos pa nyid dang / dge slong mas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang / dag gi rnam par rig byed dang / zas sbyor du bcug pa dang / dge slong gis der 'du shes pa dang zas zos pa'o //
translated: Here, whether the monk is not invited or is invited, the actual basis of a downfall occurs through six branches each.🔽In the case of not being invited, there are six: not being invited, the nun’s false praise of the quality of the food, the nun’s informative form, the monk’s acceptance of the invitation, the monk’s perception of the invitation, and the monk’s eating the food.

original: mgron du bos pa la ni mgron du bos pa nyid dang / dge slong mas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / zas lhag ma sbyor du bcug pa dang / dge slong gis der 'du shes pa dang zos pa'o //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa la ni mgron du bos pa nyid dang / dge slong mas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / zas lhag ma sbyor du bcug pa dang / dge slong gis der 'du shes pa dang zos pa'o //
translated: In the case of being invited, there are six: being invited, the nun’s false praise of the quality of the food, the nun’s verbal informative form, the monk’s acceptance of the invitation, the monk’s perception of the invitation, and the monk’s eating the food.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, it is a downfall in the sense of a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji la srid du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor bar rtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji la srid du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor bar rtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as the nun has not reached the actual basis of the downfall of engaging in sexual intercourse, she has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time she engages in the actual basis, she has a minor infraction.

original: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro ba pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro ba pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a human being, a neuter, a paṇḍaka, or a hermaphrodite, it is a minor infraction.

original: chos 'di pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: chos 'di pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a renunciate of another religion or a non-Buddhist, it is a minor infraction.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a non-human being, it is a minor infraction.

original: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //🔽dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pas sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do // dge slong ma chags pa dang / nyams pas sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is an animal, it is a downfall in the sense of a minor infraction.🔽If a nun engages in sexual intercourse with a man who is attached to or who has damaged his vows, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang khyim pas sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang khyim pas sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk, a novice, or a layperson engages in sexual intercourse, it is a minor infraction.

original: bro gar dang glu gling la mkhas pa la sogs pa yon tan gzhan dag gis sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bro gar dang glu gling la mkhas pa la sogs pa yon tan gzhan dag gis sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk is made to engage in other activities, such as dancing, singing, or playing music, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dge slong mas 'di la byin cig ces zer ba zos pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dge slong mas 'di la byin cig ces zer ba zos pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk who is begging for alms eats food that a nun tells him to eat, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang / mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang / zur gyis sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang / mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang / zur gyis sbyor du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk is made to engage in activities such as writing letters, sending messages, or using sign language, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mas gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa la dge slong gzhan gyis zos pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong mas gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa la dge slong gzhan gyis zos pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk eats food that another monk has been made to engage in activities by a nun for the benefit of others, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong @117b mas sbyor du bcug pa ma yin pa de la yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong @117b mas sbyor du bcug pa ma yin pa de la yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk eats food that has not been made to engage in activities by a nun, but he perceives that it has, or he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor pa'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor pa'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense for engaging in activities is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many offenses for engaging in activities as there are for activities.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni yon tan yang dag pa dag gis sbyor du bcug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni yon tan yang dag pa dag gis sbyor du bcug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is invited to join in the practice by those who have genuine good qualities.

original: zas ma yin ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zas ma yin ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is not food.

original: ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not eat it.

original: der 'du shes pa med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not perceive it as such.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do /
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do /
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or in pain due to an emotional disturbance.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is stated in this way: “A monk should train in not relying on a nun in any way, in any situation.”

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed de sum cu pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed de sum cu pa bshad zin to //
translated: This was the thirty-first downfall.

original: sdom la / yang yang dang ni 'dug gnas gcig / phye dang bca' dang stobs pa dang / 'dus dang dus min sog 'jog dang // kha nas med dang gsod pa nyid //
analyzed: sdom la / yang yang dang ni 'dug gnas gcig / phye dang bca' dang stobs pa dang / 'dus dang dus min sog 'jog dang // kha nas med dang gsod pa nyid //
translated: From the mouth, and killing.

original: ces bya ba ni bcu pa bzhi pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bcu pa bzhi pa yin te /
translated: This is the fourteenth.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words and the purpose of the synopsis are the same as before.

original: bcu ba bzhi pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
analyzed: bcu ba bzhi pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
translated: This fourteenth also teaches ten downfalls that require confession:

original: yang yang za ba dang / 'dug gnas su za ba dang / lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa dang / ltan gcig pa'i zas dang / spangs pa la stobs pa dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / dus ma yin par za ba dang /
analyzed: yang yang za ba dang / 'dug gnas su za ba dang / lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa dang / ltan gcig pa'i zas dang / spangs pa la stobs pa dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / dus ma yin par za ba dang /
translated: eating again and again, eating in one place, accepting more than three alms bowls, eating food of the same kind, giving to those who are not renunciants, eating in a group, eating at the wrong time,

original: gsog 'jog dang / byin len ma byas par za ba dang / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: gsog 'jog dang / byin len ma byas par za ba dang / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: storing, eating without having received the food in the alms bowl, and asking for good food.

original: de la yang yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang / bcas pa dang / gnang pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang / bcas pa dang / gnang pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The origin of the offense of eating again and again is threefold: origin, proscription, and permission.

original: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan dka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan dka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin is that the Bhagavān Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mod gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyi kun du spyod pa ni dus dang dus su sems can dmyal ba rgyu ba dang / dud 'gro rgyu ba dang / yi dgas rgyu ba dang / lha rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mod gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyi kun du spyod pa ni dus dang dus su sems can dmyal ba rgyu ba dang / dud 'gro rgyu ba dang / yi dgas rgyu ba dang / lha rgyu ba dang /
translated: The practice of the two, the venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, was to go from time to time to the realms of hell beings, animals, pretas, gods,

original: mi rgyur 'gro ba yin pas /
analyzed: mi rgyur 'gro ba yin pas /
translated: and humans.

original: de gnyis kyis de dag tu brgyus nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'ongs @118a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis de dag tu brgyus nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'ongs @118a * //
translated: After going to those realms, they came to Jambudvīpa.

original: te 'khor bzhi po dag la sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi byung ba dang gtubs pa dang / gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: te 'khor bzhi po dag la sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi byung ba dang gtubs pa dang / gcad pa dang gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: The four retinues, the suffering of sentient beings in the hells, such as being cut, split, cut to pieces, and so on, the suffering of animals, such as eating each other,

original: yi dags rnams kyi bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / ltung ba dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams kyi tshol ba dang /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / lha rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang / ltung ba dang rnam par 'thor ba dang rnam par 'jig pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / mi rnams kyi tshol ba dang /
translated: the suffering of pretas, such as hunger and thirst, the suffering of gods, such as death, falling, scattering, and disintegration, and the suffering of humans, such as searching for food,

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang dag yin pa de dag rjod par byed pas gang la la'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas tshangs par spyod pa la mngon par mi dga' bde dag des khrid de tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis ga la bder dong ste phyin nas /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis la yang dag par 'doms su 'tshol par byed /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gang dag yin pa de dag rjod par byed pas gang la la'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas tshangs par spyod pa la mngon par mi dga' bde dag des khrid de tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis ga la bder dong ste phyin nas / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis la yang dag par 'doms su 'tshol par byed /
translated: Those who are not pleased with the celibate life, who are not pleased with the celibate life of those who live with them or nearby, they lead to the venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana.🔽They seek to instruct and teach the venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana.

original: yang dag par rjes su ston du 'tshol bar byed cing tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyang de la yang dag par 'doms par byed /🔽yang dag par rjes su ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ston du 'tshol bar byed cing tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyang de la yang dag par 'doms par byed /🔽yang dag par rjes su ston par byed do //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana also instruct and teach them.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyis kyang yang dag par gdams shing yang dag par rjes su bstan pa na de dag tshangs par spyod pa la mngon par dga' zhing gong du khyad par du yang rtogs par byed do
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis kyis kyang yang dag par gdams shing yang dag par rjes su bstan pa na de dag tshangs par spyod pa la mngon par dga' zhing gong du khyad par du yang rtogs par byed do
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana also gave them instructions and teachings, and they rejoiced in pure conduct and made progress.

original: // de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis 'khor bzhi po dag gis kun du bskor zhing 'khod do //
analyzed: // de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis 'khor bzhi po dag gis kun du bskor zhing 'khod do //
translated: At that time, the Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana were surrounded and attended by the four assemblies.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo gang gis dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu gnyis 'khor bzhi bo dag gis kun du bskor zhing 'khod pa'i rgyu ni gang yin rkyen ni gang yin /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang gis dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu gnyis 'khor bzhi bo dag gis kun du bskor zhing 'khod pa'i rgyu ni gang yin rkyen ni gang yin /
translated: Ānanda, what is the cause and condition for the monk Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana being surrounded and attended by the four assemblies?

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the Venerable Ānanda explained the situation in detail, the Blessed One said:🔽Ānanda, it is not only now that Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana are surrounded and attended by the four assemblies. In the past, they were also surrounded and attended by the four assemblies.

original: kun dga' bo thams cad du dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis dang de gnyis lta bu dag mi 'byung bas de'i phyir gtsug lag khang gi sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bri bar rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo thams cad du dge slong sh'a ri'i bu dang mood gal gyi bu chen po gnyis dang de gnyis lta bu dag mi 'byung bas de'i phyir gtsug lag khang gi sgo khang du cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bri bar rjes su gnang ste /
translated: Ananda, since there will be no monks like Sariputra and Maudgalyayana, I allow you to draw a five-part wheel at the door of the temple.🔽Draw the five destinies: the destiny of hell beings, the destiny of animals, the destiny of hungry ghosts, the destiny of gods, and the destiny of humans.

original: 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro @118b ba dang / yi dgas kyi 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba dang / mi'i 'gro bdag las ma mthar sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas kyi 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro'i 'gro @118b ba dang / yi dgas kyi 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba dang / mi'i 'gro bdag las ma mthar sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas kyi 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: Draw the lower destinies of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: gong du lha dang mi'i 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du lha dang mi'i 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: Draw the higher destinies of gods and humans.

original: nang gi phyogs bzhir shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'dzam bu'i gling yang bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi phyogs bzhir shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'dzam bu'i gling yang bri bar bya'o //
translated: Draw the four inner directions: Videha in the east, Godaniya in the west, Kuru in the north, and Jambudvipa.

original: dbus su 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag phug ron dang / sbrul dang / phag gi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dag phug ron dang / sbrul dang / phag gi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle, one should draw the forms of a dove, a snake, and a pig, which are the symbols of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: gong du sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor dkar po bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor dkar po bri bar bya'o //
translated: Above, one should draw the mandala of the white nirvana of the Buddha-body.

original: khor khor yug tu rdzus te skye ba'i sems can zo chun rgyud mo'i tshul gyis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag kyang bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: khor khor yug tu rdzus te skye ba'i sems can zo chun rgyud mo'i tshul gyis 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag kyang bri bar bya'o //
translated: Around the edge, one should draw beings born by apparition, dying and being reborn like the turning of a waterwheel.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dag kyang bri bar bya zhen /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dag kyang bri bar bya zhen /
translated: One should draw the twelve members of dependent origination in their forward and reverse sequences.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa srin po'i gzugs kyis bzung ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa srin po'i gzugs kyis bzung ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: All of them should be drawn as being impermanent, seized by the forms of the rākṣasas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis po //
translated: The two verses:

original: brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
translated: One should undertake and emerge,

original: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
translated: enter into the teaching of the Buddha,

original: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
analyzed: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
translated: like an elephant from a mud hut.

original: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde ni gzhom par bya //
translated: One should destroy the army of the Lord of Death.

original: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
translated: Whoever practices well

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
translated: in this Dharma and Vinaya

original: skye bo'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye bo'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: will abandon the cycle of birth and death

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed par 'gyur //
translated: and put an end to suffering.

original: zhes bya ba yang bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang bri bar bya'o //
translated: This should be written down.

original: der bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la de ston par 'gyur ba ni dge slong nus pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: der bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa rnams la de ston par 'gyur ba ni dge slong nus pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: When brahmins and householders come and gather, the monks should appoint a capable monk to teach them.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de bzhin rjes su bsgrubs so //🔽rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de bzhin rjes su bsgrubs so // rgyal po'i khab na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: The monks did as instructed.

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: In Rājagṛha, there lived a certain householder. He took a wife from a family of equal status, and he enjoyed himself with her.🔽He took pleasure with her.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de'i bu byung nas /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa de'i bu byung nas /
translated: A son was born to them.

original: des chung ma la smas pa /
analyzed: des chung ma la smas pa /
translated: He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo bdag cag gis nor 'phrog pa /
analyzed: bzang mo bdag cag gis nor 'phrog pa /
translated: “My dear, we have lost our wealth.

original: longs spyod 'phrog pa byung gi kho bos zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por 'jug go //
analyzed: longs spyod 'phrog pa byung gi kho bos zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por 'jug go //
translated: We have lost our possessions. I will take goods and go to sea.”

original: rje'i sras de ltar mdzod cig / de zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por zhugs pa dang / de de nyid du tshul ma yin bas sdug bsngal bar gyur to //
analyzed: rje'i sras de ltar mdzod cig / de zong thogs te rgya mtsho chen por zhugs pa dang / de de nyid du tshul ma yin bas sdug bsngal bar gyur to //
translated: He took his goods and went to the great ocean, and there he suffered misfortune.

original: chud ma des khye'u de nye du'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te /
analyzed: chud ma des khye'u de nye du'i stobs dang lag stobs kyis bsnyod cing gsos te /
translated: The mother raised the boy with the strength of her relatives and the strength of her own hands.

original: @119a * // bskyed nas des yi ge dang yig 'bru dag slob tu bcug nas /
analyzed: @119a * // bskyed nas des yi ge dang yig 'bru dag slob tu bcug nas /
translated: When he was grown, she had him study letters and syllables.

original: de 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud la shin tu mkhas par gyur te /🔽khye'u de ne'u ldangs dang lhan cig 'od ma'i tshal du song ste gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / des sgo khang na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong nas des dge slong la dris pa /
analyzed: de 'jig rten gyi gtam rgyud la shin tu mkhas par gyur te / khye'u de ne'u ldangs dang lhan cig 'od ma'i tshal du song ste gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / des sgo khang na cha lnga pa'i 'khor lo bris pa mthong nas des dge slong la dris pa /
translated: He became very learned in the stories of the world.

original: 'phags pa 'di ci lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di ci lags /
translated: The boy went to the Bamboo Grove with some young men and entered the monastery. He saw a five-part wheel drawn in the entrance hall and asked a monk, Noble one, what is this?

original: dge slong des de'i lo rgyus rgya cher bshad pa dang / khye'u de lhar skye bar 'dod nas des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des de'i lo rgyus rgya cher bshad pa dang / khye'u de lhar skye bar 'dod nas des smras pa /
translated: The monk explained its history in detail, and the boy, wishing to be born as a god, said, Noble one,

original: 'phags pa bdag gis las ci bgyis na des bdag lhar skye bar 'gyur ba ma mchis sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gis las ci bgyis na des bdag lhar skye bar 'gyur ba ma mchis sam /
translated: What karma have I created that will lead to my rebirth as a god?

original: bzhin bzangs yod do //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs yod do //
translated: The man said, Yes, there is.

original: 'phags pa gang lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa gang lags /
translated: What is it, noble one?🔽 The man said, Go forth in the presence of the Blessed One and practice pure conduct for life.

original: bzhin bzangs bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu byung la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig / gal te de mi nus na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ji srid 'tsho'i bar du lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag
analyzed: bzhin bzangs bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rab tu byung la ji srid 'tsho'i bar du tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig / gal te de mi nus na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar ji srid 'tsho'i bar du lnga pa tshangs par spyod pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag
translated: If you are unable to do that, then in the presence of the Blessed One take the five precepts of pure conduct for life and practice them.

original: long shig / gal te mi nus nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol cig dang des khyod lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: long shig / gal te mi nus nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol cig dang des khyod lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you are unable to do that, then invite the community of monks headed by the Buddha for a meal. That will lead to your rebirth among the gods.

original: khye'u de la k'ar sh'a pa na'i 'byor bdag med nas des tshong dpon dang pa can zhig la gla mir khas blangs nas k'ara sh'a pa na dag bsgrubs te /
analyzed: khye'u de la k'ar sh'a pa na'i 'byor bdag med nas des tshong dpon dang pa can zhig la gla mir khas blangs nas k'ara sh'a pa na dag bsgrubs te /
translated: The man had no wealth of his own, so he agreed to work for a wealthy merchant and earned some money.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun de nyid du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun de nyid du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs so //
translated: He invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house for the midday meal.

original: drug sde dag gis dris pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis dris pa /
translated: The group of six asked,

original: su'i khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs /
analyzed: su'i khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs /
translated: “Whose house did you invite the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to for the midday meal?”

original: khyim bdag gi bu che ge mo zhig gi'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu che ge mo zhig gi'o //
translated: “The house of a certain householder’s son.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: de ni gla mi yin bas des ci zhig sbyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni gla mi yin bas des ci zhig sbyin par 'gyur /
translated: “He’s a servant. What could he possibly give?”

original: sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong la dbyar sus bzas 'dong po zhes de dag sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong la dbyar sus bzas 'dong po zhes de dag sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They went to the houses of the benefactors and asked, “Who will eat in the rainy season?” They went to the houses of the benefactors,🔽and the benefactors said,

original: 'phags pa dag gdan cung gsol cig / de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis der khye'u sus zos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gdan cung gsol cig / de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis der khye'u sus zos te /
translated: “Noble ones, please sit down.”🔽“Very well,” they said, and they sat down.🔽The benefactors saw that the boy was eating with them,

original: khye'u de'i bkad sar bkad pa dang / de dag sngar khyim gzhan du khye'u sus zos pas mnga' gang bas gus par byas te zas mi za ba khye'u des mthong do //
analyzed: khye'u de'i bkad sar bkad pa dang / de dag sngar khyim gzhan du khye'u sus zos pas mnga' gang bas gus par byas te zas mi za ba khye'u des mthong do //
translated: and they saw that the boy, who had not previously eaten out of respect, was eating.

original: mthong nas kyang des bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang des bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa /
translated: When he saw that, he said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di na 'phags pa gcig gus par bgyis te mi 'tshal na bdag lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar mi 'gyur lags pa snyam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di na 'phags pa gcig gus par bgyis te mi 'tshal na bdag lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar mi 'gyur lags pa snyam /
translated: “Blessed One, if a noble one here does not eat out of respect, I think I will not be born among the gods.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @119b pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal @119b pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bzhin bzangs re zhig gnas mal gyi longs spyod kyis kyang khyod lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur na kha zas kyi longs spyod kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs re zhig gnas mal gyi longs spyod kyis kyang khyod lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur na kha zas kyi longs spyod kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag gi bu de la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: “Good man, if you are born among the gods through the enjoyment of bedding and seats, what need is there to mention the enjoyment of food?”🔽Then the Blessed One, with a talk consistent with the Dharma, instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: enthused, and delighted the householder’s son.🔽He taught him,🔽encouraged him,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and rejoiced with him.

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: In many ways, with a talk consistent with the Dharma, he instructed,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He caused them to take it up, and he gladdened them.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //🔽de'i tshe na tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshod cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas ltogs par gyur pa dag gis khye'u des tshong dpon de'i khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so // de'i tshe na tshong pa lnga brgya tsam rgya mtsho chen po nas rgyal po'i khab tu lhags nas rgyal po'i khab tu dus ston byung bas tshod cung zad kyang ma rnyed nas ltogs par gyur pa dag gis khye'u des tshong dpon de'i khyim du sangs rgyas la sogs
translated: Then he rose from his seat and departed.🔽At that time, about five hundred merchants had come from the great ocean to Rājagṛha. Since a festival was taking place in Rājagṛha, they did not get anything to eat for a while and became hungry. They heard that the boy had invited the Buddha and the community of monks to his house for a meal,

original: pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol par thos nas der lhags te zas kyi mjug lhag nyo bar brtsams pa dang / khye'u des rin mi dgos par de dag kha zas kyis tshim par byas so //
analyzed: pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol par thos nas der lhags te zas kyi mjug lhag nyo bar brtsams pa dang / khye'u des rin mi dgos par de dag kha zas kyis tshim par byas so //
translated: and they came there, intending to buy the leftovers. The boy satisfied them with food without charging anything.

original: tshong pa de dag dga' nas khye'u de la rin po che mang po dag kyang byin no //
analyzed: tshong pa de dag dga' nas khye'u de la rin po che mang po dag kyang byin no //
translated: The merchants were delighted and gave the boy many jewels.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na tshong dpon bu med pa zhig dus la bab nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na tshong dpon bu med pa zhig dus la bab nas /
translated: At that time, in Rājagṛha, a merchant who had no son died.

original: nor can dag dang tshong dpon dag dang ded dpon dag 'dus te /
analyzed: nor can dag dang tshong dpon dag dang ded dpon dag 'dus te /
translated: The wealthy, the merchants, and the caravan leaders gathered together and said,🔽“Sirs, whom shall we anoint as the city’s merchant leader?”

original: shes ldan dag bdag cag gis gang zhig grong khyer gyi tshong dpon du dbang bskur bar bya zhes mi ma yin pa che bzhir dris pa dang khye'u de la bab nas /
analyzed: shes ldan dag bdag cag gis gang zhig grong khyer gyi tshong dpon du dbang bskur bar bya zhes mi ma yin pa che bzhir dris pa dang khye'u de la bab nas /
translated: They asked the four great kings, and they said, “Anoint the boy.”

original: khye'u de grong khyer gyi tshong dpon du dbang bskur ro /
analyzed: khye'u de grong khyer gyi tshong dpon du dbang bskur ro /
translated: So they anointed the boy as the city’s merchant leader.

original: tshong dpon des kyang sems can 'di ni bsod nams dang dbang che bar grangs pa yin gyi 'di la gcam bsag bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: tshong dpon des kyang sems can 'di ni bsod nams dang dbang che bar grangs pa yin gyi 'di la gcam bsag bya'o snyam nas /
translated: The merchant leader thought, “This being is known to have great merit and power. I will flatter him.”

original: rang gi bu mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te grong khyer gyi tshong dpon de'i chung mar byin nas /
analyzed: rang gi bu mo rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te grong khyer gyi tshong dpon de'i chung mar byin nas /
translated: He adorned his daughter with all kinds of ornaments and gave her to the city’s merchant leader as his wife.

original: de'i khyim nor mang zhing longs spyod dag gis 'phral la mngon par mthos par gyur nas de'i ming 'phral la mthos zhes bya bar gyur to de nas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de'i khyim nor mang zhing longs spyod dag gis 'phral la mngon par mthos par gyur nas de'i ming 'phral la mthos zhes bya bar gyur to de nas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the head merchant Sudden Increase thought,

original: bdag gi khyim na dpal gyis 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la brten nas bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge @120a * //
analyzed: bdag gi khyim na dpal gyis 'byor pa phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la brten nas bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge @120a * //
translated: “All the perfect wealth and prosperity in my house is due to the Buddha, the Blessed One. I invited the Buddha and the community of monks to my house

original: 'dun khyim gzhan du spyan drangs te /🔽gdugs tshod gsol ba las gyur pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: 'dun khyim gzhan du spyan drangs te / gdugs tshod gsol ba las gyur pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: and offered them a meal.🔽That is how it happened.”

original: de nas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rang gi khyim du spyan drangs te gdugs tshod gsol nas /
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rang gi khyim du spyan drangs te gdugs tshod gsol nas /
translated: Then the head merchant Sudden Increase invited the Blessed One and the community of monks to his house and offered them a meal.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos khyo shug gnyis kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pas tshong dpon 'phral la mthos khyo shug gnyis kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
translated: The Blessed One taught the Dharma, and immediately the merchant and his wife manifested the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
translated: This is what happened.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do /
translated: For some time the Blessed Buddha did not establish training precepts for the hearers in the Vinaya.

original: // so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Monastic Training, a commentary on the Prātimokṣa Sūtra,

original: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu drug pa /
translated: Volume twenty-six

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab nas yangs pa can gal ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs nas yang pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab nas yangs pa can gal ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs nas yang pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction to the rules: The Blessed Buddha, having traveled through the country from Rājagṛha to Vaiśālī, stayed in a multi-storied building by the Monkey Pond in Vaiśālī.🔽The householder Caṇḍa heard about this

original: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis thos nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag drag shul can gyis thos nas /
translated: and thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He went to the Blessed One, and upon his arrival he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: and then sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das khyim bdag brag shul can la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das khyim bdag brag shul can la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
translated: When he had sat to one side, the Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted the householder Gṛdhakūṭa with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽He perfectly instructed him, perfectly inspired him,

original: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: perfectly fired him up,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and perfectly delighted him.

analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: and having perfectly delighted him, he remained silent.

translated: Then the householder Aḍakapāṇi invited the Blessed One and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to take their meal at his house the next day.

original: phyi de nyin par gdugs tshong la bab pa dang / spyan 'dren gyis spyan drangs pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
analyzed: phyi de nyin par gdugs tshong la bab pa dang / spyan 'dren gyis spyan drangs pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
translated: The next day, when it was time for the meal, the saṅgha of monks had already gone to the invitation,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsong snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsong snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
translated: but the Blessed One remained in his room and manifested equanimity.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /🔽dga' bo nye dga' sbyin bdag ge @120b khyim dag tu 'dong zhes de dag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid nas ches sngar yangs pa can du zhugs nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa / dga' bo nye dga' sbyin bdag ge @120b khyim dag tu 'dong zhes de dag gis bsod snyoms pa zhig kyang khrid nas ches sngar yangs pa can du zhugs nas /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“Nandaka, Upanandaka, let’s go to the houses of the benefactors.” They took a monk who ate almsfood with them and went to the houses of the benefactors in Śrāvastī.

original: sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong ba dang de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi khyim dag tu dong ba dang de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽“Noble ones, who will serve the meal?”

original: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
analyzed: kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
translated: “We were invited.”

original: sus / khyim bdag drag shul can gyis so //
analyzed: sus / khyim bdag drag shul can gyis so //
translated: The householder Aṅgada.

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

analyzed: 'phags pa dag 'o na aa mra'i khur bdag gsol cig / de ltar bya'o zhes de dag gis aa mra'i khur bdag zos so //
translated: “Noble ones, then please eat the mango juice.” “Very well,” they said, and they ate the mango juice.

original: bsod snyoms pa de mi za nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de mi za nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The alms-round monk did not eat it, and they said,

analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyang aa mra'i khur bdag gsol cig / des smras pa /
translated: “Noble one, please eat the mango juice.” “

original: kho bo stan gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo stan gcig pa yin no //
translated: I am a one-seater.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'o na snoms te bzhud la de nyid du gsol cig / des lhung bzed chung du bkang ste der song ngo //
analyzed: 'o na snoms te bzhud la de nyid du gsol cig / des lhung bzed chung du bkang ste der song ngo //
translated: “Then take it with you and eat it there.” He filled his small alms bowl and went there.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'khod par rig nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'khod par rig nas /
translated: Then the householder Aṅgada, knowing that the community of monks was comfortably seated,

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
translated: with his own hands satisfied them with pure, fresh food and drink and served them.

original: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can bsod snyoms pa de'i mdun du 'dug pa dang / bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag drag shul can bsod snyoms pa de'i mdun du 'dug pa dang / bsod snyoms pa des bsams pa /
translated: Then the householder Aḍakapāṇi sat down in front of the alms-beggar, and the alms-beggar thought,

analyzed: khyim bdag 'dis bdag la 'di ltar 'dis aa mra'i khur bzos so zhes bya ba de ltar rig par 'gyur gyi /
