original: ji srid du 'dis bdag la klan ka ma rnyed pa de srid du bdag gis 'di la brjod par bya'o snyam nas smras pa /
analyzed: ji srid du 'dis bdag la klan ka ma rnyed pa de srid du bdag gis 'di la brjod par bya'o snyam nas smras pa /
translated: “As long as he doesn’t find fault with me, I’ll tell him.”

original: khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig aa mra'i khur bdag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i khur bdag zos so //
analyzed: khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig aa mra'i khur bdag zos par ma zad kyi drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i khur bdag zos so //
translated: “Householder, not only did I eat the mango dish, but the group of six ate the mango dish.”

original: khyim bdag gis 'phags pa ci'i phyir de skad ces zer zhes spyos te smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis 'phags pa ci'i phyir de skad ces zer zhes spyos te smras pa /
translated: The householder scolded him, saying, “Noble one, why do you say that?”

original: 'phags pa ci kho bo la aa mra'i khur bdag med snyam mam zhes des zho shas 'tsho ba dag aa mra'i khur bdag gi sprog mdag kha 'byed du bcug go //
analyzed: 'phags pa ci kho bo la aa mra'i khur bdag med snyam mam zhes des zho shas 'tsho ba dag aa mra'i khur bdag gi sprog mdag kha 'byed du bcug go //
translated: “Noble one, do you think I don’t have a mango dish?” He had the servants open the bag of mango dishes.

original: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms grub pa des skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms grub pa des skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the monk who had completed his alms round told the Blessed One in detail what had happened, and the Blessed One, with this event, this basis, and this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: He questioned the group of six,🔽“This is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,🔽it is not proper for one gone forth to do.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /🔽bslab pa @121a * //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de / bslab pa @121a * //
translated: He censured them in many ways,

original: bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: and seeing the ten benefits of establishing training rules, he decreed to my hearers, “This is how you should recite the training rule:

original: yang yang za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang yang za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If one eats again and again, one commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni spod byed /
analyzed: yul ni spod byed /
translated: The place was Pāvā.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The individuals were the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zas la gdu ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zas la gdu ba /
translated: The affliction was craving for food.

original: nyes pa ni yang yang za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni yang yang za ba'o //
translated: The offense is a transgression with every repetition.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can na spre'u rdzing gi 'gram khang pa brtsegs pa'i khang bzangs na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the permission: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Vaiśālī, in the Gabled Hall by the lake.

original: dge slong na ba zhig sman pa'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong na ba zhig sman pa'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: A sick monk went to the doctor and said,🔽“Sir, prescribe medicine for me.”🔽“Noble one, who will prepare your medicine?”

original: bzhin bzangs kho ba la sman ston cig /'phags pa je zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho ba la sman ston cig /'phags pa je zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
translated: “Sir, the Blessed One does not allow it.”

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas /🔽de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar gyur pa gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas / de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar gyur pa gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Noble one, your teacher is compassionate.🔽It is possible that he will make an exception in this case.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I rescind the rule that monks should not have others prepare their medicine.

original: dge slong dag mchod rten gyi las dang dge 'dun gyi las dag byas pa na de dag bkres nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na /
analyzed: dge slong dag mchod rten gyi las dang dge 'dun gyi las dag byas pa na de dag bkres nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na /
translated: Monks, when they were making a stūpa and a saṅgha hall, they were hungry and lay down on their sides. They were unable to do their virtuous activities.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Faithful brahmins and householders came and said,

original: 'phags pa dag bstan pa la gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba lags na /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bstan pa la gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba lags na /
translated: “Noble ones, you should be dedicated to the teachings.

original: ci'i slad du glos phab ste gzims shing dge ba'i phyogs la tron mi mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i slad du glos phab ste gzims shing dge ba'i phyogs la tron mi mdzad /
translated: Why do you lie down on your sides and not do your virtuous activities?”

original: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag bkres so //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag bkres so //
translated: “Good sirs, we are hungry.”🔽“Noble ones, who will give you food?”🔽“Good sirs, the Blessed One has laid down a rule.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na las kyi dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na las kyi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I will lay down a rule.

original: dge slong gzhan dag lam du zhugs pa na bkres par gyur nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag lam du zhugs pa na bkres par gyur nas glos phab ste nyal zhing dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par mi nus pa na /
translated: Other monks who were traveling on the road became hungry and lay down to rest, unable to practice virtue.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag lhags nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: Faithful brahmins and householders came and said,

original: 'phags pa dag bstan pa la gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba lags na ci'i slad du glos phab ste gzims shing dge ba'i phyogs la tron mi mdzad /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bstan pa la gcig tu brtson par bgyi ba lags na ci'i slad du glos phab ste gzims shing dge ba'i phyogs la tron mi mdzad /
translated: “Noble ones, you should be dedicated to the teachings. Why do you lie down to rest and not practice virtue?”

original: @121b bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag bkres so //
analyzed: @121b bzhin bzangs dag kho bo cag bkres so //
translated: “Good people, we are hungry.”🔽“Noble ones, who will give you food?”🔽“Good people, the Blessed One has laid down a rule.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na lam gyi dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na lam gyi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I will not lay down a rule.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod du gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod du gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One went to Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa de'i kun tu spyod pa ni chos brgyad dang bcu bzhi la bsnyen gnas la gnas shing /
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa de'i kun tu spyod pa ni chos brgyad dang bcu bzhi la bsnyen gnas la gnas shing /
translated: In Śrāvastī there lived a householder who always observed the eight-part and the fourteen-part upavāsa.

original: ji srid du dge 'dun bkres pa dag zan ma byin gyi bar du bdag nyid zan za bar mi byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du dge 'dun bkres pa dag zan ma byin gyi bar du bdag nyid zan za bar mi byed do //
translated: He would not eat until he had fed the hungry saṅgha.🔽Then, when the time came for the householder to observe the upavāsa, he sent a message to the monastery to invite the hungry saṅgha to come.

original: de nas khyim bdag de bsnyen gnas la gnas pa'i dus la bab pa'i tshe des gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun bkres pa dag 'bod par btang ba dang / de'i tshe khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du spyan drangs nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de bsnyen gnas la gnas pa'i dus la bab pa'i tshe des gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun bkres pa dag 'bod par btang ba dang / de'i tshe khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du spyan drangs nas /
translated: At that time, a householder had invited the saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha to his house.

original: gtsug lag khang na dge slong gcig kyang mi 'khod nas khyim bdag des mi mngags te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang na dge slong gcig kyang mi 'khod nas khyim bdag des mi mngags te /
translated: Since there was not a single monk left in the monastery, the householder sent a messenger🔽to the place where the saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha had been invited, to invite the hungry saṅgha to come.

original: gang du sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de nas dge 'dun bkres pa dag 'bod du btang ba dang / de dag der zan zos zin pas ma 'ongs so //
analyzed: gang du sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de nas dge 'dun bkres pa dag 'bod du btang ba dang / de dag der zan zos zin pas ma 'ongs so //
translated: But since they had already eaten there, they did not come.

original: de nas yong mi mngags te khyim bdag gi mchid nas /
analyzed: de nas yong mi mngags te khyim bdag gi mchid nas /
translated: Then send someone to tell the householder,🔽‘Come to the meal and I will give you a bolt of cloth.’

original: tshur spyon gdugs tshod gsol dang / ras yug chen 'bul zhes mchi'o zhes byos shig ces gos sbyin pa'i zas la bos pa na dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: tshur spyon gdugs tshod gsol dang / ras yug chen 'bul zhes mchi'o zhes byos shig ces gos sbyin pa'i zas la bos pa na dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: When the monks were summoned to the meal given by the cloth-giver, they said,🔽“We have already refused.”

original: kho bo cag gis spangs so zhes zer zhing ma 'ongs nas khyim bdag des bdag gis dge 'dun bkres pa bshos ma gsol to zhes zan bcad pa bsgrubs pa dang / de'i ngos kyi khyim tshes dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag gis byin na yang zan zar mi btub pas khyim bdag 'dis dge slong dag gis zan ma zos pa'i phyir zan bcad pa byas so zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis spangs so zhes zer zhing ma 'ongs nas khyim bdag des bdag gis dge 'dun bkres pa bshos ma gsol to zhes zan bcad pa bsgrubs pa dang / de'i ngos kyi khyim tshes dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong 'di dag gis byin na yang zan zar mi btub pas khyim bdag 'dis dge slong dag gis zan ma zos pa'i phyir zan bcad pa byas so zhes smod par byed /
translated: When they did not come, the householder thought, “I have not fed the saṅgha and have not made an offering.” He fasted, and the people in his neighborhood said, “These śramaṇas, the sons of the Śākya, have been given food, but they will not eat. Because this householder has not fed the monks, he is fasting.”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Monks, you should not refuse an invitation to a meal.

original: de ltar bas na gos sbyin pa'i tshe ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar bas na gos sbyin pa'i tshe ma gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, it is only when giving clothes that this is not a downfall.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i @122a * //🔽bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i @122a * // bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One praised those who desired training, those who respected training, and those who were ascetic with regard to training.

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i chos kyis bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che pa dang / de dang ldan pa'i chos kyis bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: Having spoken in a way that was consistent with that, that was mostly about that, and that was full of that,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: he said to the monks,

original: dag slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dag slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore this training should be undertaken like this:🔽‘I will not eat more than two meals a day, except on an occasion when the Saṅgha is distributing special foods or when I am sick or when I am traveling or when I am giving a discourse or when I am making an effort at spiritual practice or when I am fasting.

original: 'di ni gnad pa yin te /🔽nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gnad pa yin te / nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: This is the proper conduct.’

original: yang yang za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //🔽de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang yang za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do // de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‘On an occasion when the Saṅgha is distributing special foods’ means:

original: na ba dus so //
analyzed: na ba dus so //
translated: when one is sick;

original: las dus so //
analyzed: las dus so //
translated: when one is working;

original: lam dus so //
analyzed: lam dus so //
translated: when one is traveling;

original: gos sbyin pa'i tshe dus te de la de ni dus yin no zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i tshe dus te de la de ni dus yin no zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: when one is giving a discourse;🔽when one is making an effort at spiritual practice;🔽when one is fasting.

original: yul ni spong byed dang mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni spong byed dang mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
translated: The person is a Buddhist monk.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no affliction or fault.

original: de la yang yang za na zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du za na'o //
analyzed: de la yang yang za na zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du za na'o //
translated: “If he eats again and again” means if he eats again and again.

original: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus gzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except on an occasion” means except on an occasion that is allowed.🔽“Offense” means that one will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the bad rebirths of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshed par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshed par byed /
translated: “Burned” means that one will be burned.🔽“Cooked” means that one will be cooked.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Fallen” means that one will be fallen.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and is not disclosed, it is an obscuration to the wholesome dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be an offense.

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: “The occasion is this:

original: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: When sick, it is the occasion” means as follows:

original: dge slong zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus na'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus na'o //
translated: If a monk is unable to live on one meal.

original: las dus so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las dus so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When working, it is the occasion” means as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: It is like this:

original: mchod rten gyi las phyag dar re lde tsam byas sam /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi las phyag dar re lde tsam byas sam /
translated: if one has done even a little work for the Saṅgha of monks or for a stūpa,

original: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas na'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas na'o //
translated: or if one has swept the courtyard of the stūpa even a little.

original: lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dge slong dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam de'i phyed du song ste phyir log na'o //
analyzed: lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dge slong dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam de'i phyed du song ste phyir log na'o //
translated: The time of the path is like this: if a monk has gone one krośa or half a krośa and returns.

original: gos sbyin pa'i tshe dus te zhes bya ba ni ras yug phran nam ras yug chen thob na'o //
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i tshe dus te zhes bya ba ni ras yug phran nam ras yug chen thob na'o //
translated: The time of receiving cloth is when one obtains a small or large piece of cloth.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba'i dus yin no //
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba'i dus yin no //
translated: In that case, that is the time. In that case, that is the permitted time for establishing the basis of training.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense in this case?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the classification of offenses, the absence of offenses, the training, and the restoration, as follows.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam @122b du ma song bas nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas cig car yang rung /🔽phyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam @122b du ma song bas nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas cig car yang rung / phyis kyang rung ste /
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is defined as a monk who is not sick, who has not done his work, and who has not gone on a journey, and who eats the food of an invitation to two meals of five kinds of food, whether simultaneously or later, that are offered by different donors in one day.

original: gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa'i zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa zos na yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa'i zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa zos na yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats the food of the invitation, he commits the actual downfall of eating.

original: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he is not sick, has not done his work, and has not gone on a journey, he commits an infraction of the rule.

original: 'dir na ba'i tshad ni zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //🔽las kyi chad ni dge 'dun gyi 'am /🔽mchod rten gyi las phyag dar re lde tsam byas nas sam /
analyzed: 'dir na ba'i tshad ni zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o // las kyi chad ni dge 'dun gyi 'am / mchod rten gyi las phyag dar re lde tsam byas nas sam /
translated: Here, the measure of being sick is being unable to survive on one meal.🔽The measure of work is having done work for the community or for a stupa, even if it is only sweeping the floor once.

original: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o //
translated: Or it is having made a mandala offering.

original: lam gyi tshad ni dpag tshad gcig tu song ba nyid do //🔽nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas cig car yang rung ba phyis kyang rung ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyi tshad ni dpag tshad gcig tu song ba nyid do // nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas cig car yang rung ba phyis kyang rung ba ste /
translated: The measure of the path is one krośa.🔽It is proper to eat the food of the invitation of the five kinds of food, such as alms, etc.,

original: gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa'i zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa'i zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: when one has not obtained the robe or the price of the robe, even if the donors are different, even if it is at different times.

original: de'i rnam par gzhag pa ni nyi ma gcig la dge slong sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la dus gcig du bos kyang rung snga phyir bos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par gzhag pa ni nyi ma gcig la dge slong sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la dus gcig du bos kyang rung snga phyir bos kyang rung ste /
translated: The rule is that when a bhikṣu is invited by different donors to eat the five kinds of food on the same day, it is proper to eat at one time, either earlier or later.

original: dus gcig tu bos pa la ni dge slong nyid kyi blos gang sngar bza'o snyam pa de ni snga ma yin la /🔽gang phyis bza'o snyam pa de ni phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gcig tu bos pa la ni dge slong nyid kyi blos gang sngar bza'o snyam pa de ni snga ma yin la / gang phyis bza'o snyam pa de ni phyi ma yin no //
translated: If invited at one time, the bhikṣu himself should think, “I will eat earlier,” or “I will eat later.”

original: snga phyir bos pa la ni sbyin bdag gang gis sngar bos pa de ni snga ma yin la /
analyzed: snga phyir bos pa la ni sbyin bdag gang gis sngar bos pa de ni snga ma yin la /
translated: If invited earlier or later, the donor who invites earlier is earlier,🔽and the donor who invites later is later.

original: sbyin bdag gis phyis bos pa de ni phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis phyis bos pa de ni phyi ma yin no //
translated: The later invitation by the patron is the later.

original: de dag las snga ma dang phyi ma nyi ma gcig pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag las snga ma dang phyi ma nyi ma gcig pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the earlier and later being on the same day.

original: sbyin bdag tha dad pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag tha dad pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the patrons are different.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi ga zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga gang yang rung ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma gnyi ga zas bza' ba rnam pa lnga gang yang rung ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if both the earlier and later are included in any of the five types of food.

original: snga ma zos nas phyi ma yang za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: snga ma zos nas phyi ma yang za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one eats the later after having eaten the earlier.

original: snga ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: snga ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa yod kyang rung med kyang rung ste /
translated: There is no fault if the earlier has or does not have the acquisition of cloth or the price of cloth.

original: phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the later does not have the acquisition of cloth or the price of cloth.

original: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon te /
analyzed: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon te /
translated: Here, the end of cloth is a suitable piece of cloth one cubit in size.

original: gos mi rung ba dang / rung ba khru gang gi byon bas chung ba dang / de tsam ri ba'i rin la na smad pa med do /
analyzed: gos mi rung ba dang / rung ba khru gang gi byon bas chung ba dang / de tsam ri ba'i rin la na smad pa med do /
translated: There is no fault if the cloth is unsuitable, or if the cloth is less than a suitable piece one cubit in size, or if the price of that is less than the price of a suitable piece one cubit in size.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang nyi ma gcig pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag tha dad pa dang / zas bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa rnyed pa nyid yin pa dang / dge slong na ba dang / las byas pa dang /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang nyi ma gcig pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag tha dad pa dang / zas bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa rnyed pa nyid yin pa dang / dge slong na ba dang / las byas pa dang /
translated: The agent of this is the one invited to both, the one day, the different benefactors, the one included in the five who eat the food, the sick monk, the one who has done work,

original: @123a * // lam du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: @123a * // lam du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid do //
translated: the one who has gone on the road, the one who is not invited to the later invitation, and the one who does not obtain cloth or the price of cloth.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, it is a basis of downfall through possessing ten limbs:

original: dge slong na ba 'am las byas pa dang lam du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas la bos pa nyid yin pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong na ba 'am las byas pa dang lam du song ba ma yin pa nyid dang / mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas la bos pa nyid yin pa dang /
translated: The sick monk, the one who has done work, the one who has gone on the road, the one invited to both, the one day, the different benefactors, the one included in the five who eat the food, the one invited to eat the food,

original: snga ma zos pa dang / mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid dang phyi ma de zos pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma zos pa dang / mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid dang phyi ma de zos pa'o //
translated: The first is eating the food, and the second is eating the food after being invited, but without the acquisition of cloth or the price of cloth.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the factors are incomplete, then one is not faulted, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall through transgression is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du yang yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du yang yang za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi lam thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the process of the downfall of eating again and again, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽mgron du bos pa gnyis cig car dang du len pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // mgron du bos pa gnyis cig car dang du len pa la nyes byas so //
translated: For each time one begins the process of the actual basis, there is a minor offense.🔽Accepting two invitations to meals at the same time is a minor offense.

original: snga ma zos nas phyi mkhas blangs pa'i dus na nyes byas so //
analyzed: snga ma zos nas phyi mkhas blangs pa'i dus na nyes byas so //
translated: When one has eaten the food of the first invitation and then accepts the second, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through transgression of the process is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: For as many processes as there are, there are also that many processes of the process.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation is a misdeed.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The application is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong na ba dang / las byas pa dang / lam du song ba nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong na ba dang / las byas pa dang / lam du song ba nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is sick, if he has already done work, or if he is traveling.

original: mgron du bos pa gnyis nyi ma tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa gnyis nyi ma tha dad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the two invitations are on different days.

original: sbyin bdag gcig pa nyid la ltung ba med do //🔽mgron du bos pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas kyi rnyed pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gcig pa nyid la ltung ba med do // mgron du bos pa gnyis las gang yang rung ba gcig bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas kyi rnyed pa yin la /
translated: There is no offense if the invitations are from the same patron.

original: gcig de ma yin pa'i zas gzhan nyid yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gcig de ma yin pa'i zas gzhan nyid yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one of the two invitations is for food that is not one of the five foods that must be consumed before noon.

original: snga ma ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: snga ma ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the first invitation has not been accepted.

original: mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa yod pa nyid la ltung ba med de /
analyzed: mgron du bos pa phyi ma la gos sam gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa yod pa nyid la ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if the second invitation is for cloth or the price of cloth.

original: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni gos rung ba khra gang gi khyon te /
analyzed: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni gos rung ba khra gang gi khyon te /
translated: Here, “cloth” means a suitable piece of cloth that is one cubit long.

original: de yan chad la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the invitation is for more than that.

original: gos kyi rin ni gos kyi zong ste /
analyzed: gos kyi rin ni gos kyi zong ste /
translated: The price of cloth is the price of cloth goods.

original: de yang gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon yan chad ri ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de yang gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon yan chad ri ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: Moreover, there is no offense if the cloth is suitable, and the price is the value of cloth worth at least one dharaṇa.

original: bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
translated: An invitation is not an invitation to a meal. There is no offense if the invitation is not to a meal.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni yon bdag gis nyin gcig mchad par bshams pa'i zas nar ma bshams pa ni dus ston la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la lan 'ga' @123b gang du glo bur du bos pa de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni yon bdag gis nyin gcig mchad par bshams pa'i zas nar ma bshams pa ni dus ston la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la lan 'ga' @123b gang du glo bur du bos pa de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The definition of an invitation to a meal is a meal that a patron has prepared for one day. A regular meal is a meal that is prepared on a daily basis, such as on the day of a festival. A sudden invitation is an invitation to a meal that is not an invitation to another meal.

original: kun du lta ba yang mgron du bos ba nyid ma yin bas de la yang ltung ba med do //🔽de'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang ngam /
analyzed: kun du lta ba yang mgron du bos ba nyid ma yin bas de la yang ltung ba med do // de'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang ngam /
translated: A visit is not an invitation to a meal. There is no offense if the visit is not an invitation to a meal.🔽The definition of a visit is a visit that is made out of respect for the customs of the world,

original: bshes pa'i dbang gis nye bar lta ba ni kun du lta ba ste /
analyzed: bshes pa'i dbang gis nye bar lta ba ni kun du lta ba ste /
translated: or out of respect for a friend.

original: de la mgron du byas pa zos pa yang mgron du pos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mgron du byas pa zos pa yang mgron du pos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: A visit is not an invitation to a meal. There is no offense if the meal is eaten after a visit that is not an invitation to a meal.

original: tho 'tshams pas byas pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pas byas pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: Also, if the invitation is for the purpose of harming, it is not an invitation, and so there is no offense.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni gal te tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can 'ga' zhig gis dge slong mgron du bos nas de'i 'og tu dge slong des mgron du bos pa gzhan du song ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni gal te tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can 'ga' zhig gis dge slong mgron du bos nas de'i 'og tu dge slong des mgron du bos pa gzhan du song ste /
translated: The definition is this: if someone with the intention to harm invites a monk, and then that monk goes to another invitation,

original: zos pa de mgron du pos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zos pa de mgron du pos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: then that is not another invitation.

original: mi rung ba la bos pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //🔽de'i mtshan nyid ni bza' bar bya ba mi rung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi rung ba la bos pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do // de'i mtshan nyid ni bza' bar bya ba mi rung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Also, if the invitation is for something unsuitable, it is not an invitation, and so there is no offense.

original: byin len ma byas pa dang / mi gcig pa la sogs pa'i sha la sogs pa la mgron du bos pa yang mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa dang / mi gcig pa la sogs pa'i sha la sogs pa la mgron du bos pa yang mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The definition is this: if the food to be eaten is unsuitable, such as meat that has not been blessed, or the meat of animals that have not been slaughtered for the occasion, then the invitation is not another invitation.

original: dge slong de'i phyir ma yin par dge 'dun spyir spyan drangs pa yang dge slong de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong de'i phyir ma yin par dge 'dun spyir spyan drangs pa yang dge slong de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med de /
translated: Also, if one invites the saṃgha in general, not for the sake of a single monk, then even if that monk is invited, there is no offense, because he is not invited separately.

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyis klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa btul ba'i phyir chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa lta bu ma yin pa'o
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid ni 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyis klu aa mra'i chu dogs pa btul ba'i phyir chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs pa lta bu ma yin pa'o
translated: At that time, the characteristics of the invitation are not like the invitation of the saṅgha of monks headed by the Buddha by the brahmins and householders of the island of Śroṇāparāntaka on the mountain of the crocodile killer, for the sake of taming the nāga of the mango grove, the ārya Su­bhūti.

original: // gzhan du lnga po 'jog pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: // gzhan du lnga po 'jog pa yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pas de la yang ltung ba med de /
translated: Also, if one invites the five, not for the sake of a single monk, then there is no offense, because he is not invited separately.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni dge slong kha gnyis su mgron du bos pas mgron du bos pa'i gnas gcig tu bdag nyid za zhing mgron du bos pa'i gnas gzhan cig shos su dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge slob ma dang /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni dge slong kha gnyis su mgron du bos pas mgron du bos pa'i gnas gcig tu bdag nyid za zhing mgron du bos pa'i gnas gzhan cig shos su dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge slob ma dang /
translated: The definition of that is: having been invited to two households, one eats at one invited household and sends another fully ordained monk or nun, female novice, male or female novice, or male or female candidate to the other invited household.

original: dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma'i sde pa lnga po thams cad dam /🔽gang yang rung ba 'jog par yang de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma'i sde pa lnga po thams cad dam / gang yang rung ba 'jog par yang de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The definition of that is: when a monk is invited to two places, he eats in one of the invited places, and he places the other invited place in the hands of any one of the five groups of monks, nuns, female novices, male or female probationary nuns,🔽or novices.🔽If he places the other invited place in the hands of any one of the five groups, it is not another invited place.

original: mgron du bos pa gzhan blang ba yod par lnga po 'jog par yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin bas de la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa gzhan blang ba yod par lnga po 'jog par yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin bas de la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: If he accepts another invited place, he does not have an offense, because it is not the invited place itself.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni sbyin bdag gi zas blang zhing sngon du yod pa de sde pa lnga po nod du bcug pa yang dge slong de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni sbyin bdag gi zas blang zhing sngon du yod pa de sde pa lnga po nod du bcug pa yang dge slong de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'o /
translated: The definition of that is: when he accepts the food of a patron, and he makes the five groups accept the food that is already there, it is not another invited place of that monk.

original: mu ge byung ba na mgron du bos pa ji snyid byung ba dag @124a * //
analyzed: mu ge byung ba na mgron du bos pa ji snyid byung ba dag @124a * //
translated: When famine occurs, one should give as much as one can to those invited as guests.

original: bdag gir byas pa dang / zos pa dang / lnga po la sbyin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa dang / zos pa dang / lnga po la sbyin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: If famine occurs, there is no offense if one appropriates, eats, or gives away as much food as one can obtain as a guest in someone’s home.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, if one is insane, if one is deranged, if one is overwhelmed by pain, or if one is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya pa ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du yang yang za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya pa ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du yang yang za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule on eating again is to be trained in not eating again after eating a proper meal.

original: gtsug lag khang dang khyim gzhan du yang zas la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang khyim gzhan du yang zas la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should accept an invitation to eat in a monastery or in a house.

original: dus shes par byas te 'jug par bya'i /
analyzed: dus shes par byas te 'jug par bya'i /
translated: One should go after ascertaining the time.

original: snga tshogs su mi bya'o //
analyzed: snga tshogs su mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go too early.

original: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa de'i phyir dus la bab na gand'i brdungs te /
analyzed: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa de'i phyir dus la bab na gand'i brdungs te /
translated: If one is invited to a house for a meal, one should go there when the time has come, after the wooden sounding blocks have been struck.

original: gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis rang gi 'khor gang dang gang yin pa dag la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis rang gi 'khor gang dang gang yin pa dag la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The elders should look after their own retinue.

original: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa rnams la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o //🔽dge slong nad pa la sogs pa rgyu med par khro ba la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa rnams la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o // dge slong nad pa la sogs pa rgyu med par khro ba la sogs pas sam /
translated: The elder of the saṃgha should look after the newly arrived monks.🔽The monks should not, without reason, such as illness, etc., or out of carelessness, etc.,

original: le lo la sogs pas gya tshom du rang gi zan gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas gya tshom du rang gi zan gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: break their own fast.

original: gal te yon bdag 'dir dge slong dag gis skom btung bar bya'o zhes gsol ba 'debs par byed na dge slong dag gis khyim gzhan du der ci ran gcig bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yon bdag 'dir dge slong dag gis skom btung bar bya'o zhes gsol ba 'debs par byed na dge slong dag gis khyim gzhan du der ci ran gcig bsdad par bya'o //
translated: If the patron invites the monks to drink water, the monks should stay in that house for as long as is necessary.

original: gal te dge slong nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas sngar gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa yang rung de med pa yang rung ba zhig tu bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas la mgron du bos te zos pa'i rjes la gos sam
analyzed: gal te dge slong nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas sngar gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa yang rung de med pa yang rung ba zhig tu bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas la mgron du bos te zos pa'i rjes la gos sam
translated: If a monk is invited by a different patron for a meal that is part of the five offerings, whether it is for a single day or for a single meal, and whether or not he has already received robe-cloth or the value of a robe, he should go to that place.

original: gos kyi rin med pa dang / gos mi rung ba dang / gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon pas chung pa dang / de tsam ri ba'i gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'i mgron du bos pa bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas kyi rnyed pa can du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rin med pa dang / gos mi rung ba dang / gos rung ba khru gang gi khyon pas chung pa dang / de tsam ri ba'i gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'i mgron du bos pa bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa'i zas kyi rnyed pa can du 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not go to the house of the one who invites him to eat the five foods, if he has no money for the cloth, or if the cloth is unsuitable, or if the suitable cloth is less than a cubit, or if he has the money for the cloth but not the cloth.

original: gal te dge slong nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas sngar gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa yang rung de med pa yang rung ba zhig tu zas la mgron du bos pa'i rjes la gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'i mgron du bos
analyzed: gal te dge slong nyi ma gcig la sbyin bdag tha dad pas sngar gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa yang rung de med pa yang rung ba zhig tu zas la mgron du bos pa'i rjes la gos sam gos kyi rin dang bcas pa'i mgron du bos
translated: If a monk is invited to eat by a different patron on a different day, either with cloth or with the price of cloth, whether he has or has not,

original: pa zas kyi rnyed pa can gzhan zhig kyang byung na de'i tshe dge slong des zas snga ma la spong ba bsrung zhing 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: pa zas kyi rnyed pa can gzhan zhig kyang byung na de'i tshe dge slong des zas snga ma la spong ba bsrung zhing 'jug par bya ste /
translated: if he is invited to eat by another who has cloth or the price of cloth, then at that time the monk should protect the former invitation to eat and should not go.

original: de'i rjes la phyi mar yang 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la phyi mar yang 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: He should go to the latter one after that.

original: zan snga ma la spong ba srung pa ni phyi ma la spangs pa za ba'i ltung byed dang lhag bor bya ba'i tshegs spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zan snga ma la spong ba srung pa ni phyi ma la spangs pa za ba'i ltung byed dang lhag bor bya ba'i tshegs spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of observing the former is to avoid the downfall of eating what is abandoned and to avoid the trouble of eating leftovers.

analyzed: mu ge byung @124b na dge slong mgron du bos pas 'khor lnga po dag la sbyin bdag de'i zas sbyin pa na /
translated: When famine occurs, if a lay person invites the five orders of monks to a meal,

analyzed: gal te sbyin pa po mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur ba ltan rang gi kham gnyis sam gsum zos pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa po la khyim bdag dge slong ngam 'khor lnga po 'di bsod snyoms kyis phongs pa yin gyi rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig dang

analyzed: / 'di la sbyin par bya'o zhes mngon par dga' bar byas nas /

translated: he should give to the five orders of monks.

analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gcig pa bshad zin to /

analyzed: // /'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /

analyzed: bcas pa dang gnang pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of downfalls, according to whether they are transgressions of rules that are prohibitions or transgressions of rules that are permissions.🔽The origin of the downfall of eating in a dwelling place that is a transgression of a rule that is a prohibition

translated: When the Blessed One had displayed the great miracles in Śrāvastī,🔽he had defeated the non-Buddhist ascetics,

analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag tshar bcad cing /
translated: and

analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na gcer bu pa drug cu ri brags der lhags nas khyim bdag des de dag la mkho ba stobs par byed pa de'i tshe na mnyan yod nas tshong pa dad pa can zhig zong thogs te ri brags der 'ongs pa de yang khyim bdag des
translated: One day, sixty naked ascetics came to that hill town. The householder provided for their needs. At that time, a faithful merchant from Śrāvastī came to that hill town with goods. The householder

analyzed: der bos pa na tshong pa des 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gi song la blta'o snyam na /

analyzed: des der song ba dang ji tsam na gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba sha stag yin bar mthong ngo //

analyzed: gis smras pa /
translated: “Friend,

analyzed: grogs po zhing bzang po gzhan 'ga' yang yod dam / des smras pa /
