original: dga' bo nye dga' spyod yul tshig cing me mdag zhi bar ma gyur gyi tshur shog mnyan yod du 'dong ngo zhes de dag mnyan yong du dong ba na /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' spyod yul tshig cing me mdag zhi bar ma gyur gyi tshur shog mnyan yod du 'dong ngo zhes de dag mnyan yong du dong ba na /
translated: “Nandaka and Upanandaka, the area is covered with dust and the embers have not been extinguished. Come, let’s go to Śrāvastī.” They went to Śrāvastī.

original: lho phyogs nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i rgol ba 'char ka zhes bya ba zhig mnyan yod du 'ongs pa tshe dang ldan pa sh'ari'i bus btul te /
analyzed: lho phyogs nas 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i rgol ba 'char ka zhes bya ba zhig mnyan yod du 'ongs pa tshe dang ldan pa sh'ari'i bus btul te /
translated: From the south, a materialist challenger named Udayana came to Śrāvastī. The venerable Śāriputra subdued him.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byas shing /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du byas shing /
translated: He went forth in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya, was fully ordained, and manifested the fruit of an arhat.🔽In dependence on him, many hundreds of thousands of beings attained the fruits of the noble ones.

original: de la brten nas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs 'bum phrag du mdag gis kyang 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa'i tshe drug sde mnyan yod du lhags @125b nas /
analyzed: de la brten nas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs 'bum phrag du mdag gis kyang 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur pa'i tshe drug sde mnyan yod du lhags @125b nas /
translated: At that time, the group of six arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: The monks said to them,🔽“Venerables, welcome!

original: 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: Welcome!

original: khyed cag ga las 'ongs /
analyzed: khyed cag ga las 'ongs /
translated: Where have you come from?”

original: tshe dang ldan ba sh'a ri'i bus lho phyogs nas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rgol pa bram ze kun du rgyu 'char ka zhes bya ba 'gyed 'dod cing 'gyed pa'i yo byad kyi phyir 'os mtshar bcad de g-yul las rnam par rgyal lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba sh'a ri'i bus lho phyogs nas 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rgol pa bram ze kun du rgyu 'char ka zhes bya ba 'gyed 'dod cing 'gyed pa'i yo byad kyi phyir 'os mtshar bcad de g-yul las rnam par rgyal lo //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra, from the south, having defeated the heretic brahman wandering mendicant Udraka, who was eager to debate and had seized the property of others for the purpose of debate, returned victorious from the battle.

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshogs can gnyis pa chos kyi dmag dpon chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su bskor bas rgyal ba gcig tshar bcad pa 'di do mtshar ci che /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu tshogs can gnyis pa chos kyi dmag dpon chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su bskor bas rgyal ba gcig tshar bcad pa 'di do mtshar ci che /
translated: Venerable ones, it is not surprising that the venerable Śāriputra, the second in the assembly, the general of the Dharma, having turned the wheel of the Dharma, has defeated one opponent.

original: gal te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshar bcad par ma gyur na yang bcom ldan 'das slad na bzhugs pa de ngo mtshar mi che'i /
analyzed: gal te tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshar bcad par ma gyur na yang bcom ldan 'das slad na bzhugs pa de ngo mtshar mi che'i /
translated: If the venerable Śāriputra had not defeated him, it would not be surprising that the Blessed One, who is present, would do so.

original: kho bo cag mi drug gis gcer bu pa drug cu tshar bcad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag mi drug gis gcer bu pa drug cu tshar bcad pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is surprising that we six have defeated sixty naked ascetics.

original: rig pa'i gnas gang gis dbyug pa'i rig pas lus la chos bshad pas so //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas gang gis dbyug pa'i rig pas lus la chos bshad pas so //
translated: The knowledge by which he was struck was the knowledge of the Dharma.

original: ji 'tsho 'am 'on te shi /
analyzed: ji 'tsho 'am 'on te shi /
translated: “Is he alive or dead?”🔽“We don’t know whether he is alive or dead.”🔽The monks who had few desires complained and criticized him,

original: de'i tshe na ni 'tsho na da tsa 'tsho 'am shi gtol med do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tshar bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong par byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slod rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni 'tsho na da tsa 'tsho 'am shi gtol med do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tshar bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong par byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slod rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: “How could a monk boast with the very limbs that should be ashamed?”🔽They told the Blessed One what had happened,🔽and the Blessed One, having given a teaching on the topic of the Dharma, gathered the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gis dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gis dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the group of six did this?”

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not suitable for the group of six🔽to do such a thing.🔽It is not proper.

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not conducive to being a monastic.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not conducive to being a monastic.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba yin ni zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba yin ni zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: He criticized them in many ways, saying, This is what renunciates do?

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Seeing the ten benefits of establishing the precepts, he said, My disciples should recite this basis of training in the Vinaya:

original: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge lon pa'i dge slong gis bsod snyoms gcig bca' par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge lon pa'i dge slong gis bsod snyoms gcig bca' par bya'o //
translated: A monk who has stayed one night in the same dwelling should eat one alms meal.

original: de las lhag par ba na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par ba na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: Eating more than that is a downfall.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen dang 'thab krol byed pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen dang 'thab krol byed pa /
translated: The people were the group of six. The affliction was attachment to desire and quarrelsomeness.

original: nyes pa ni 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pas bsod snyoms gcig las lhag par za ba'o //🔽gnang pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan @126a * //
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pas bsod snyoms gcig las lhag par za ba'o // gnang pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan @126a * //
translated: The fault was eating more than one alms meal after staying one night in the same dwelling.

original: yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background story of the allowance is this. The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: de nas yang mnyan yod pa'i tshong ba de zong thogs te /
analyzed: de nas yang mnyan yod pa'i tshong ba de zong thogs te /
translated: Then the merchant from Śrāvastī, carrying his wares,

original: ri brags de nyid du phyin nas de khyim bdag de'i tshod khang du zhugs pa dang / ri brags pa'i khyim bdag des yang gcer bu pa dag la zas brim par brtsams nas /
analyzed: ri brags de nyid du phyin nas de khyim bdag de'i tshod khang du zhugs pa dang / ri brags pa'i khyim bdag des yang gcer bu pa dag la zas brim par brtsams nas /
translated: went to that hill station. He stayed in the house of that householder, and the householder of the hill station began to serve food to the naked ascetics.

original: des mnyan yod ba'i tshong pa de'i gan du mi mngags te grogs po sbyin gas dag la zas brim par byas tshur shog ces sbran pa dang / mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa de dad pa can yin pas des pas bsams pa /
analyzed: des mnyan yod ba'i tshong pa de'i gan du mi mngags te grogs po sbyin gas dag la zas brim par byas tshur shog ces sbran pa dang / mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa de dad pa can yin pas des pas bsams pa /
translated: He sent a man to the merchant from Śrāvastī, saying, “Friend, the food is served to the naked ascetics. Come!” The merchant from Śrāvastī was faithful. He thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gi song la blta'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gcer bu ba ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba dag yin par mthong nas mngon sum du mi snyan par brjod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin pas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gi song la blta'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gcer bu ba ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba dag yin par mthong nas mngon sum du mi snyan par brjod pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin pas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
translated: “They must be disciples of the Blessed One. I will go and see.” He went there and saw that they were naked ascetics who had cast off shame and modesty. He thought, “It is painful to say unpleasant things to their faces,” so he remained silent.

original: gcer bu pa de dag zos te dong ba dang ri brags pa'i khyim bdag gis mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa de la smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa de dag zos te dong ba dang ri brags pa'i khyim bdag gis mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa de la smras pa /
translated: The naked ascetics ate them and left. The householder of the mountain village said to the merchant of Śrāvastī,

original: grogs po sa bon bzang zhing zhing bzang ngam /
analyzed: grogs po sa bon bzang zhing zhing bzang ngam /
translated: “Friend, are the seeds good and the field good?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: grogs po sa bon ni bzang na zhing ni gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba sdig ba'i lta ba can dgon dung tsha sgo can tha chad sdig pa can gyi sa gzhi sha stag yin no //
analyzed: grogs po sa bon ni bzang na zhing ni gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba sdig ba'i lta ba can dgon dung tsha sgo can tha chad sdig pa can gyi sa gzhi sha stag yin no //
translated: “Friend, the seeds are good, but the field is full of naked ascetics who have no shame or modesty, have evil views, are contemptible, sinful, and are a mere basis for evil.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: grogs po zhing bzang po gzhan 'ga' yod dam /
analyzed: grogs po zhing bzang po gzhan 'ga' yod dam /
translated: “Friend, are there any other good fields?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: yod de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go //
analyzed: yod de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag go //
translated: “Yes, the Bhagavān’s śrāvakas.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: grogs po de dag gi mi nga yang ma smos shig / des smras pa ji de dag 'dir byon par gyur tam lhags so //
analyzed: grogs po de dag gi mi nga yang ma smos shig / des smras pa ji de dag 'dir byon par gyur tam lhags so //
translated: “Friend, don’t mention them to me. They are not people.” He said, “Did they come here?” “They came.”🔽“Who are they?”

original: gang dag drug sde dag go //
analyzed: gang dag drug sde dag go //
translated: “They are the group of six.”

original: de dag gis re zhig ci byas /
analyzed: de dag gis re zhig ci byas /
translated: “What did they do?”

original: 'di dang 'di lta'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta'o //
translated: “This and that.”🔽He said,

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The man said, I am not a thief.

original: grogs po khyod kyis rgya mtsho chen po nas nor bu mching bu dag blangs so //
analyzed: grogs po khyod kyis rgya mtsho chen po nas nor bu mching bu dag blangs so //
translated: “Friend, you have brought back glass beads from the great ocean.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos bzang po gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos bzang po gzhan dag kyang yod dam /
translated: “Are there any other good disciples of the Blessed One?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: yod de / gal te khyod kyis tshe dang ldan par sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chen po gzhan dag mthong bar gyur na khyod mngon par dad par 'gyur ba de lta du'i gnas yod do //
analyzed: yod de / gal te khyod kyis tshe dang ldan par sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu chen po dang / nam gru dang / ma 'gags pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chen po gzhan dag mthong bar gyur na khyod mngon par dad par 'gyur ba de lta du'i gnas yod do //
translated: “Yes, if you were to see the Blessed One’s other great disciples, such as the venerable Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Revata, Aniruddha, and so on, you would have great faith.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: gal te de dag 'dir byon par gyur na bdag gis de dag la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba bstabs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag 'dir byon par gyur na bdag gis de dag la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba bstabs par bya'o //
translated: “If they were to come here, I would offer them the necessities of alms.”

original: mnyan yod pa'i tshod pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: mnyan yod pa'i tshod pa des bsams pa /
translated: The merchant of Śrāvastī thought,

original: da ni @126b bdag song la bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: da ni @126b bdag song la bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “Now I will go and ask the Blessed One.”

original: tshong pa des zong bsgyur te rin blangs nas mnyan yod du song ste /
analyzed: tshong pa des zong bsgyur te rin blangs nas mnyan yod du song ste /
translated: The merchant did business, got his money back, and went to Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te gsol pa btsun pa ri brags che ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig mchis pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyis slad du 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te gsol pa btsun pa ri brags che ge mo zhig na khyim bdag che ge mo zhig mchis pa des phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams kyis slad du 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal te /
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and said, “Lord, in such-and-such a village there is a certain householder. He has built a monastery for the monks and brahmins of the four directions.

original: de de na gang gnas pa de la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba stobs par bgyid cing /
analyzed: de de na gang gnas pa de la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba stobs par bgyid cing /
translated: He provides the necessities for those who live there.

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag mthong bar 'tshal na /
translated: He wants to see the Blessed One’s disciples.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dge slong dag cig bka' stsal na legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la thugs brtse ba'i slad du dge slong dag cig bka' stsal na legs so //
translated: Blessed One, it would be good if you would send some monks out of compassion for him.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the householder by his silence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gang gis khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag sus 'dul bar 'gyur snyam du dgongs na dge slong sh'a ri'i bus 'dul bar gzigs na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gang gis khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag sus 'dul bar 'gyur snyam du dgongs na dge slong sh'a ri'i bus 'dul bar gzigs na /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought, “By which monk will the householder and his retinue, and the people living in that hill town, be tamed?” He saw that they would be tamed by the monk Śāriputra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa /🔽sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis ri brags ga ge mo zhig na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa / sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyis ri brags ga ge mo zhig na /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra,🔽“Śāriputra, think of a certain householder and his retinue in a certain hill town, and the people living in that hill town.”

original: khyim bdag che ge mo 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag la soms shig / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' mnyan nas 'khor lnga brgya dang /🔽ri brags de ga la ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing song nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag che ge mo 'khor dang bcas pa dang / ri brags de na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dag la soms shig / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' mnyan nas 'khor lnga brgya dang / ri brags de ga la ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing song nas /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said, “Respected Blessed One, I will do as you ask,” and he set out to wander through the country with a retinue of five hundred.

original: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags der phyin nas /
analyzed: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags der phyin nas /
translated: He wandered through the country and eventually arrived at that hill town.

original: khyim bdag de'i 'dug gnas su zhugs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag de'i 'dug gnas su zhugs so //
translated: and entered the house of that householder.

original: khyim bdag des de thos nas der song ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag des de thos nas der song ste /
translated: When that householder heard that, he went there,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'chal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'chal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: bowed his head at the feet of the Venerable Śāriputra, and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed /🔽yang dag par gzengs stong bar byed /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par byed / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par byed / yang dag par gzengs stong bar byed /
translated: When he had sat to one side, the Venerable Śāriputra, with a Dharma discourse, instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed do //🔽rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed do // rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: animated, and delighted that householder.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod //
translated: Having instructed, inspired, animated, and delighted him with a Dharma discourse in a variety of ways,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas nas cang mi smra'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas nas cang mi smra'o //
translated: he remained silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag de stan las lngas te /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag de stan las lngas te /
translated: Then that householder rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @127a * //🔽ri'i bu ga la de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @127a * // ri'i bu ga la de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He draped his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: btsun pa sh'a de'i bu sang bdag shi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a de'i bu sang bdag shi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang /
translated: and then, bowing down with palms together toward the venerable Śāriputra, he said to him, “Venerable Śāriputra, please accept tomorrow’s meal together with the community of monks in my house.”

original: tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
analyzed: tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyim bdag de la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs so //
translated: The venerable Śāriputra assented to the householder by his silence.

original: de nas khyim bdag nges de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa sta gon byas nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag nges de nyid kyi mtshan mo bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pa sta gon byas nas /
translated: Then, that very night, the householder prepared pure and fine food and drink.

original: nang par sngar langs te stan bshams nas /
analyzed: nang par sngar langs te stan bshams nas /
translated: In the morning, he rose, prepared seats,

original: chu ra nor bu can bzhag ste /
analyzed: chu ra nor bu can bzhag ste /
translated: and set out a precious water vessel.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu spyan 'dren gyis btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu spyan 'dren gyis btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na /
translated: He then sent a messenger to invite the venerable Śāriputra, saying, “Venerable Śāriputra, the meal is ready.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes bskul to //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bus da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes bskul to //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, please consider that the time has come.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snga dro sham thabs bgos ltung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu snga dro sham thabs bgos ltung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, in the morning, put on his lower robe and upper robe, took his alms bowl,

original: dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
translated: and, surrounded by a group of monks,

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas khyim bdag de'i khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mdun du bdar nas khyim bdag de'i khyim ga la ba der song ste phyin nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
translated: with the community of monks in front, went to the house of that householder. When he arrived, he sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'dug bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar 'dug bar rig nas /
translated: Then the householder, knowing that the community of monks headed by the venerable Śāriputra was seated,

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byed cing stobs par byed do //
translated: with his own hands served and satisfied them with excellent food and drink.

original: rnam grangs du mar bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byas shing bstabs te /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas rang gi lag nas tshim par byas shing bstabs te /
translated: He satisfied him with his own hand with pure, fine, and delicious food and drink.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zan zos shing lag pa bsnyal /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu zan zos shing lag pa bsnyal /
translated: When the venerable Śāriputra had eaten, washed his hands and bowl,

original: ltung bzed bzhag par rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te /
analyzed: ltung bzed bzhag par rig nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te /
translated: and put his bowl away, the householder took a very low seat

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go //
translated: and sat down in front of the venerable Śāriputra to listen to the Dharma.

original: 'dug nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'dug nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When he was seated, the householder said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu chos bstan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, please teach the Dharma.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said,

original: khyim bdag de'i phyir khyod kyis sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan 'ding du chug la /
analyzed: khyim bdag de'i phyir khyod kyis sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan 'ding du chug la /
translated: “Householder, for that reason you should have a large area cleared and have seats prepared

original: ri brags 'dir skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ri brags 'dir skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu chos ston par 'gyur gyi /
translated: for a great gathering of people in this town, because tomorrow the noble Śāriputra will teach the Dharma.”

original: khyed cag las gang chos nyan bar 'dod pa de shog shig ces dril bsgrags pa byed du chug shig / de nas tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: khyed cag las gang chos nyan bar 'dod pa de shog shig ces dril bsgrags pa byed du chug shig / de nas tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yon bshad pa byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, having given the discourse, rose from his seat and left.

original: khyim bdag de ri brags de gtso bor grags pa yin @127b bas des sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan shom du bcug nas /
analyzed: khyim bdag de ri brags de gtso bor grags pa yin @127b bas des sa phyogs go skabs yangs par stan shom du bcug nas /
translated: Since that householder was the most famous person in that mountain town, he had a spacious place prepared and had it announced:🔽Tomorrow the noble Śāriputra will teach the Dharma to the great assembly of people in this mountain town. Those of you who wish to hear the Dharma, come!

original: ri brags der skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus chos ston par 'gyur gyis khyed cag las gang chos nyan bar 'dod pa de shog shig / khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa /
analyzed: ri brags der skye bo phal po che'i tshogs la sang 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus chos ston par 'gyur gyis khyed cag las gang chos nyan bar 'dod pa de shog shig / khyed cag las gang gis der bden pa dag mthong bar ma gyur pa /
translated: Those of you who do not see the truths there

original: des 'khor bar yun ring du 'khor bar bya dgos so zhes dril bsgrags pa byed du bcug go //
analyzed: des 'khor bar yun ring du 'khor bar bya dgos so zhes dril bsgrags pa byed du bcug go //
translated: will have to wander in saṃsāra for a long time.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyi de nyin par phyogs der song ste /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyi de nyin par phyogs der song ste /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, on the following day, went to that place.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la 'dug pa dang / srog chags 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of living beings gathered, some out of curiosity,

original: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge pa'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na 'dus gyur nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge pa'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na 'dus gyur nas /
translated: and some because they were urged on by the roots of virtue they had created in the past.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus la 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus la 'khor de'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams dang rang bzhin shes nas /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the assembly,

original: 'di ltar khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong zhing kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim bdag de 'khor dang bcas pa dang / srog chags khri nyis stong gis bden pa dag mthong zhing kha cig gis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: taught the Dharma accordingly. The householder and his retinue, and twelve thousand living beings, saw the truths. Some actualized the fruit of stream entry,

original: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: some actualized the fruit of once-returner,

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas /
translated: some actualized the fruit of nonreturner,

original: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste /
translated: and some went forth.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
translated: Having abandoned all afflictions, they manifested arhatship.

original: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a śrāvaka.

original: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: Some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha.

original: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te /
translated: Some generated the intention to achieve unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In that way, he taught the Dharma to the assembly, and most of them were established in devotion to the Buddha, in devotion to the Dharma, and in devotion to the Saṅgha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lha cang yun rin du chos bstan pas gdugs tshod yol zhing rlung gis de'i rgyab na bar gyur nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus lha cang yun rin du chos bstan pas gdugs tshod yol zhing rlung gis de'i rgyab na bar gyur nas /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra taught the Dharma to the gods for a long time. It was past noon, and a wind arose that blew his robe.

original: khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: The householder said,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, please sit down.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de'i slad du bdag gi 'dug gnas su bzhugs shig dang / bdag gis khyod la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba stabs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de'i slad du bdag gi 'dug gnas su bzhugs shig dang / bdag gis khyod la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba stabs par bgyi'o //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, please stay in my house. I will provide you with whatever you need.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: The venerable Śāriputra said,

original: khyim bdag khyod nyid la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar mdzad kyi 'gro'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag khyod nyid la brten nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar mdzad kyi 'gro'o //
translated: “Householder, the Blessed One has established the bases of training for the hearers in the monastic code in dependence on you. I will go.”

original: @128a * // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu na bzhin du zan bcad de /🔽ri brags de nas mnyan yong ga la bde logs su rgyu zhing song ste /
analyzed: @128a * // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu na bzhin du zan bcad de / ri brags de nas mnyan yong ga la bde logs su rgyu zhing song ste /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, sick and fasting,🔽left that mountain town and went to Śrāvastī.

original: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas /
analyzed: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin nas /
translated: Traveling gradually, he arrived at Śrāvastī.

original: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag la dris pa /
translated: The monks asked the venerable Śāriputra’s pupils and attendants,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji ltar bde bar ba rgyus sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji ltar bde bar ba rgyus sam /
translated: “Venerables, did you travel comfortably?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zhig bde bar yang brgyus /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag cung zhig bde bar yang brgyus /
translated: “Venerables, I have been happy for a while,

original: cung zhig sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
analyzed: cung zhig sdug bsngal bar yang brgyus so //
translated: and I have been unhappy for a while.”

original: ci zhig bde bar brgyus /
analyzed: ci zhig bde bar brgyus /
translated: “What was it to be happy?”

original: mkhan pos gdul ba'i bya ba 'di snyed cig mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhan pos gdul ba'i bya ba 'di snyed cig mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni bde bar brgyus pa yin no //
translated: “It was to have done so much to tame the preceptor.”

original: ci zhig sdug bsngal bar brgyus /
analyzed: ci zhig sdug bsngal bar brgyus /
translated: “What was it to be unhappy?”🔽“It was to have left the village while the preceptor was sick and had not eaten his meal.”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: mkhan po bsnyung bzhin du gdugs tshod bcad de ri brags de nas bzhud pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin no zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽de lta bas na /
analyzed: mkhan po bsnyung bzhin du gdugs tshod bcad de ri brags de nas bzhud pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin no zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / de lta bas na /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: na ba ma gtogs te dge slong gis pus 'khyud bcad bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: na ba ma gtogs te dge slong gis pus 'khyud bcad bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: “Therefore, I allow you not to break the sitting meditation except if you are sick.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das yis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags ba brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das yis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags ba brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke in praise of desiring to learn, of respecting the training, and of being content with few desires.

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mched mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mched mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore I rescind the former and

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: I allow the latter.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training rule like this:

original: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge slong mi na pas bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge slong mi na pas bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: ‘When a monk who is not sick eats one alms-offering in one inhabited area, he should not eat a second alms-offering in that same inhabited area.

original: de las lhag par za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: If he eats a second alms-offering, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this training rule is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The individual is the venerable Śāriputra.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no degeneration or flaw.

original: de la 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas su zhag lon pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de la 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas su zhag lon pa'i 'o //
translated: In this training rule, “when a monk who is not sick eats one alms-offering in one inhabited area” means: in a non-monastic setting.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “A monk” means a member of this religion.

original: mi na bas zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs pas so //
analyzed: mi na bas zhes bya ba ni na ba ma gtogs pas so //
translated: “Not sick” means not having a disease.

original: bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zan lan cig go //
analyzed: bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zan lan cig go //
translated: “One should eat one alms-round” means one should eat one meal.

original: de las lhag par za na zhes bya ba ni de las lan mang du za na'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par za na zhes bya ba ni de las lan mang du za na'o //
translated: “If he eats more than that” means if he eats more than that.

original: ltung byed de zhes bya ba ni lnga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed de zhes bya ba ni lnga ma bzhin no //
translated: “That offense” means the same as the fifth one.

original: de la @128b ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la @128b ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam bar gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam bar gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the offense, the non-offense, the training, and the restoration, by the basic offense, the preparation, and the preparation for the preparation.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gnag pa ni dge slong mi na bas chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas su zhag gcig lon pa la sbyin bdag gis ma bstabs par nyi ma gnyis
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gnag pa ni dge slong mi na bas chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa mu stegs can gyi 'dug gnas su zhag gcig lon pa la sbyin bdag gis ma bstabs par nyi ma gnyis
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall of eating in a heretic's house is as follows: If a fully ordained monk who is not sick eats two meals of alms in the house of a heretic who is not a follower of this doctrine, and who is the owner of the house, then, if he stays there for one night, he commits the actual basis of the downfall of eating in a heretic's house.

original: pa'i bsod snyoms zos na 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i bsod snyoms zos na 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If the host does not offer the food, then the downfall is accrued by eating the second meal.

original: dge slong mi na ba la na smad pa med do //🔽'dug gnas chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong mi na ba la na smad pa med do // 'dug gnas chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the monk is sick, there is no downfall.🔽If the house is not that of a heretic, there is no downfall.

original: 'dug gnas de'i bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dug gnas de'i bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the owner of the house is a layperson who is a follower of this doctrine, there is no downfall.

original: 'dug gnas de mu stegs can gyi yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dug gnas de mu stegs can gyi yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the house belongs to a heretic, there is no downfall.

original: der dge slong nyi ma dang po la bsod snyoms gcig za nas chag gcig lon pas nyi ma gnyis pa'i bsod snyoms zos pa la na smad pa med do //

translated: If the monk eats one meal of alms on the first day and then, having spent the night there, eats the second meal of alms on the second day, there is no downfall.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa'i bsod snyoms sbyin bdag gis ma bstabs pa la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: bza' pa lnga'i khong su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he eats any of the five kinds of food that are allowed for the sick.

translated: The agent of this downfall is a fully ordained monk who is not sick, and the alms-giver is not a Buddhist but a non-Buddhist householder who is the owner of the place where the monks are staying.

translated: that the Blessed Buddha has not yet established a rule for his disciples in the monastic code.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyas byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //🔽mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyas byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so // mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: The introduction of the rules: The Lord Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dga' bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a householder. He took a wife from a family of equal rank. He played with her, had fun, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: He played with her, had fun, and enjoyed himself with her.🔽He played with her, had fun, and enjoyed himself with her.🔽He played with her, had fun, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: de la bu mo g-yas zhar ma cig byung nas /
analyzed: de la bu mo g-yas zhar ma cig byung nas /
translated: She gave birth to a daughter who was right-handed.

original: de bsrengs shing bskyed de chen mor gyur ti /
analyzed: de bsrengs shing bskyed de chen mor gyur ti /
translated: She was raised and grew up.

original: bu mo de'i na zla gzhan thams cad bag mar btang na /
analyzed: bu mo de'i na zla gzhan thams cad bag mar btang na /
translated: When all the other girls of her age were given in marriage,

original: bu mo de g-yas zhar ma yin pa'i phyir slong ba 'ga' 'ang ma 'ongs so //
analyzed: bu mo de g-yas zhar ma yin pa'i phyir slong ba 'ga' 'ang ma 'ongs so //
translated: no one came to ask for her hand because she was right-handed.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag gzhan zhig 'dug ba des rigs mnyam pa @130b las chung ma blangs nas /
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag gzhan zhig 'dug ba des rigs mnyam pa @130b las chung ma blangs nas /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was another householder. He took a wife from a family of equal rank.

original: de'i chud ma de rang gi las dag gis dus la bab po //
analyzed: de'i chud ma de rang gi las dag gis dus la bab po //
translated: Her time came, and she gave birth.

original: des chung ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa nas bdun pa'i bar du blangs pa dang / de dag kyang de bzhin du dus la bab po //
analyzed: des chung ma gnyis pa dang gsum pa nas bdun pa'i bar du blangs pa dang / de dag kyang de bzhin du dus la bab po //
translated: He took a second wife, a third, up to a seventh, and they all died in the same way.

original: khyim bdag de yang skur ba btab par gyur ba'i las dag gis chung ma gsod pa chung ma gsod pa zhes bya ba'i ning du gyur te /
analyzed: khyim bdag de yang skur ba btab par gyur ba'i las dag gis chung ma gsod pa chung ma gsod pa zhes bya ba'i ning du gyur te /
translated: The householder was also reviled for his actions, and he became known as “the wife-killer.”

original: des yang gzhan gyi bu mo dang yugs sa mo yang cad bslangs na sus kyang ma ster nas /
analyzed: des yang gzhan gyi bu mo dang yugs sa mo yang cad bslangs na sus kyang ma ster nas /
translated: He asked for other girls and widows, but no one would give him any.

original: de rang nyid so na ma nyed cing 'dug go //
analyzed: de rang nyid so na ma nyed cing 'dug go //
translated: He remained alone, without a wife.

original: de'i chung po grogs po zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i chung po grogs po zhig gis smras pa /
translated: A friend of his from childhood said to him,

original: gal te de lta na g-yas zhar mo slongs shig ces zer nas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na g-yas zhar mo slongs shig ces zer nas /
translated: “If that’s the case, ask for a girl with a harelip.”

original: des g-yas zhar ma'i pha ma dag las g-yas zhar ma bslangs te /
analyzed: des g-yas zhar ma'i pha ma dag las g-yas zhar ma bslangs te /
translated: He asked for a girl with a harelip from her parents,

original: bag mar blangs pa'i dus btab po //
analyzed: bag mar blangs pa'i dus btab po //
translated: and they set a date for the wedding.

original: de'i chung po grogs de yang 'gyod pa skyes te bdag gis grogs po la g-yas zhar ma slongs shig ces bskul ba de ni ma legs pa zhig byas te /
analyzed: de'i chung po grogs de yang 'gyod pa skyes te bdag gis grogs po la g-yas zhar ma slongs shig ces bskul ba de ni ma legs pa zhig byas te /
translated: The friend who had urged him to ask for a girl with a harelip felt remorse and said, “It was not good of me to urge my friend to ask for a girl with a harelip.

original: de mtshan dan pa yin pas des grogs po bsad par gyur na mi rung gi de 'dor du bcug la bdag gi srid mo yugs sa mo zhig yod pa sbyin no snyam nas /
analyzed: de mtshan dan pa yin pas des grogs po bsad par gyur na mi rung gi de 'dor du bcug la bdag gi srid mo yugs sa mo zhig yod pa sbyin no snyam nas /
translated: The king thought, It is not right for him to kill his friend, so I will have him abandon that and give him my sister-in-law who is a widow.

original: des de la de skad smras pa dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
analyzed: des de la de skad smras pa dang / khyim bdag des smras pa /
translated: He said that to him, and the householder said,

original: grogs po da de bzhin dor bar mi nus te /
analyzed: grogs po da de bzhin dor bar mi nus te /
translated: Friend, I cannot abandon him like that now.

original: 'on kyang 'di la thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la thabs kyi rnam pa zhig bya'o //
translated: However, I will do some kind of trick to him.

original: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des kyang bag rdzongs sta gon bya bar brtsams so //
analyzed: g-yas zhar ma'i ma des kyang bag rdzongs sta gon bya bar brtsams so //
translated: The mother of the one with a harelip also began to prepare a dowry.

original: de drug sde dag gi sbyin bdag yin pas /
analyzed: de drug sde dag gi sbyin bdag yin pas /
translated: Since he was a patron of the group of six,

original: drug sde dag snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: drug sde dag snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: the group of six put on their lower robes in the morning, took their bowls and robes,

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / ji tsam na g-yas zhar ma brdzang ba dang / gnyen ston gyi khur ba dag sreg pa mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs nas mthar gyis bsod snyoms la rgyu ba na khyim der zhugs pa dang / ji tsam na g-yas zhar ma brdzang ba dang / gnyen ston gyi khur ba dag sreg pa mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: and entered for alms. As they were wandering for alms in Śrāvastī, they entered that house. When they saw the one with a harelip being given away and the preparations for the wedding feast, they said, 🔽 What is this?🔽 The householder said, This is my son-in-law.

original: sring mo dus ston la bab du nye 'am ci /
analyzed: sring mo dus ston la bab du nye 'am ci /
translated: “Sister, is the festival approaching?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi lcam mo bag mar mchi ba la thug nas de'i bag rdzongs sta gon bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi lcam mo bag mar mchi ba la thug nas de'i bag rdzongs sta gon bgyi'o //
translated: “Noble ones, your sister is about to be married, so I am preparing her dowry.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: sring mo kho bo cag gis cung zad mi 'thob bam /
analyzed: sring mo kho bo cag gis cung zad mi 'thob bam /
translated: “Sister, will we get anything?”

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag la su zhig gis dbul 'tshal /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag la su zhig gis dbul 'tshal /
translated: “Noble ones, who would give to you?”🔽“This is yours.”

original: 'di nyed khyed kyi lags so zhe des bag rkyong ste de dag gi lhung bzed thams cad khur ba dag gis bkang nas /
analyzed: 'di nyed khyed kyi lags so zhe des bag rkyong ste de dag gi lhung bzed thams cad khur ba dag gis bkang nas /
translated: She prepared the dowry and filled all their alms bowls with it.

original: drug sde dag gis de'i kha zas thams cad bsdus te dong ngo //
analyzed: drug sde dag gis de'i kha zas thams cad bsdus te dong ngo //
translated: The group of six collected all her food and left.

original: de nas g-yas zhar ma'i mas chung ma gsod @131a * //
analyzed: de nas g-yas zhar ma'i mas chung ma gsod @131a * //
translated: Then the wife of the man with a goiter killed her husband.

original: pa la bu bdag cag gis kha zas dag sta gon byas par gyur pa gang yin pa de sbyin gnas dag gis bzhes kyi da nye du dag gi phyir kha zam sta gon byed kyi bar du sdod cig ces smras pa dang / chung ma gsod pas smras pa /
analyzed: pa la bu bdag cag gis kha zas dag sta gon byas par gyur pa gang yin pa de sbyin gnas dag gis bzhes kyi da nye du dag gi phyir kha zam sta gon byed kyi bar du sdod cig ces smras pa dang / chung ma gsod pas smras pa /
translated: The father of the bride said, We have prepared the food. The worthy ones have accepted it. Now wait until we prepare the food for the relatives.

original: kho bo mi sdod de gal te nyi ma de nyid la bag mar rdzong zhing sbyin na ni bag mar blang ngo //
analyzed: kho bo mi sdod de gal te nyi ma de nyid la bag mar rdzong zhing sbyin na ni bag mar blang ngo //
translated: The bride-killer said, I will not wait. If you give your daughter to me in marriage today, I will accept her as my wife.

original: gal te mi sbyin na kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi sbyin na kho bo chung ma gzhan len gyi /
translated: If you do not give her, I will take another wife.🔽 I will abandon your daughter.

original: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o zhes zer nas g-yas zhar ma'i pha mas dus su ma brdzangs pa'i skabs su chung ma gsod pas g-yas zhar mo mi blang bar byas pa na /
analyzed: khyod kyi bu mo dor bar bya'o zhes zer nas g-yas zhar ma'i pha mas dus su ma brdzangs pa'i skabs su chung ma gsod pas g-yas zhar mo mi blang bar byas pa na /
translated: When the parents of the bride did not give her away at the proper time, the bride-killer said, I will not take the bride.

original: g-yas zhar ma'i phas chung ma gsod pa bzung ste /
analyzed: g-yas zhar ma'i phas chung ma gsod pa bzung ste /
translated: The father of the bride seized the bride-killer and said, You must take her.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang du'o dod bos nas shags la bkug pa dang / chung ma gsod pas g-yas zhar ma'i pha pham par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang du'o dod bos nas shags la bkug pa dang / chung ma gsod pas g-yas zhar ma'i pha pham par byas so //
translated: He took him to the king's palace and they argued their case. The bride-killer defeated the father of the bride.

original: g-yas zhar ma'i ma de bdag gi bu mo ma lam mo zhes ngu zhing 'dug pa dang / de'i ngos kyi khyim tshes dag sh'a kya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
analyzed: g-yas zhar ma'i ma de bdag gi bu mo ma lam mo zhes ngu zhing 'dug pa dang / de'i ngos kyi khyim tshes dag sh'a kya'i bu'i dge sbyong rnams kyi dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
translated: The neighbors said, “The śramaṇas of the Śākya’s son have destroyed the way of the śramaṇas.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
translated: They have destroyed the way of the brahmins.🔽They have created an obstacle to the giving of the girl.

original: 'di ltar bu mo sbyin zin pa'i bar chad byed do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar bu mo sbyin zin pa'i bar chad byed do zhes smod par byed /
translated: ” They reviled them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: criticized them, and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this incident, because of this cause, because of this situation, assembled the community of monks and asked the group of six:🔽“Is it true, monks, that you did this?”🔽“Monks, this is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,🔽it is not suitable,🔽it is not proper,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not pardonable,

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not something that should be done by those who have gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi'i di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi'i di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, the training rules of the monastic code should be recited like this:

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim rnams su dong ba las /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim rnams su dong ba las /
translated: “If many monks go to the houses of the faithful,

original: gal te de dag las bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis phye dag dang khur ba dag dus kyis stobs par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de dag las bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis phye dag dang khur ba dag dus kyis stobs par gyur la /
translated: and if the faithful brahmins and householders offer them flour and pastries,

original: 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
translated: then, if they wish, those monks may accept two or three full alms bowls.

original: de las lhag par len na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na ltung byed do //
translated: If they accept more than that, they commit an offense.

original: ltung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la'ang bgo bsha' bya /
analyzed: ltung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar dong la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la'ang bgo bsha' bya /
translated: “Having accepted two or three full alms bowls, they should go to the outer courtyard and share them with the other monks.

original: bdag @131b cag kyang bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag @131b cag kyang bza' bar bya ste /
translated: They may then eat them themselves.

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha made a rule about this.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The persons were the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni lto 'dun //
translated: The affliction was craving.

original: nye pa ni sbyin pa dag khyim pas yongs su ma spangs pa ji bder ma byas pa'i kha zas bstabs pa la lhung bzed 'bring tshang gsum /
analyzed: nye pa ni sbyin pa dag khyim pas yongs su ma spangs pa ji bder ma byas pa'i kha zas bstabs pa la lhung bzed 'bring tshang gsum /
translated: The proximate cause was that the monks did not accept the food that the laypeople had not given up, but had prepared for their own use.

original: las lhag par len pa'o //
analyzed: las lhag par len pa'o //
translated: The action was to receive more than that.

original: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde dag go //
analyzed: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde dag go //
translated: The monk is the group of six monks.

original: rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa ni rab tu mang po dag go //
analyzed: rab tu mang po dag ces bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa ni rab tu mang po dag go //
translated: Many means more than two.

original: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gi khyim rnams su'o //
analyzed: khyim rnams su zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag dag gi khyim rnams su'o //
translated: The houses means the houses of brahmins and householders.

original: dong ba las zhes bya ba ni song ba las so //
analyzed: dong ba las zhes bya ba ni song ba las so //
translated: They went means they went.

original: gal te de dag la zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag la'o //
analyzed: gal te de dag la zhes bya ba ni dge slong de dag la'o //
translated: If they means if those monks.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faithful brahmins and householders means

original: dad pa can zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba dang / chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dag go //
analyzed: dad pa can zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la mngon par dad pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mngon par dad pa dang / sangs rgyas la skyabs su song ba dang / chos dang dge 'dun la skyabs su song ba dag go //
translated: The faithful are those who have faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and have gone for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: phye dag ces bya ba ni phye dad 'dag gu dag go //
analyzed: phye dag ces bya ba ni phye dad 'dag gu dag go //
translated: Flour is flour and rice.

original: khur ba dag ces bya ba ni bag chos dag go //
analyzed: khur ba dag ces bya ba ni bag chos dag go //
translated: Cake is a kind of pastry.

original: dus kyis stobs par gyur la zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs par gyur la'o //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs par gyur la zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs par gyur la'o //
translated: Repeatedly means again and again.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer na'o //
translated: If they wish means if they desire.

original: dge slong de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa dag gis so //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa dag gis so //
translated: Those monks means those who are monks.

original: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum bslad bar bya'o zhes bya ba la lhung bzed ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum bslad bar bya'o zhes bya ba la lhung bzed ni gsum ste /
translated: They should fill two or three alms bowls means: There are three kinds of alms bowls:

original: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: de la chen po ni ga 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i mtha'i cha kho nas mthe bo'o lto gang gis mi reg ba'o //
analyzed: de la chen po ni ga 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i mtha'i cha kho nas mthe bo'o lto gang gis mi reg ba'o //
translated: The large measure is such that when it is filled with boiled rice, with no husks, of the Māgadha country, and with the soup of the same rice, and with the vegetables of the same country, it cannot be closed with the palm of the hand.

original: 'bring ni bre'u chung phyed dang do btsos pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni bre'u chung phyed dang do btsos pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The medium measure is half of the large measure.

original: chung du ni bre'u chung gang btsos pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: chung du ni bre'u chung gang btsos pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The small measure is one-fourth of the large measure.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
translated: One large measure of boiled rice, with no husks, of the Māgadha country, is sixteen seers of the same rice, when uncooked.

original: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
translated: One seer of the Māgadha country is equal to two seers of Tibet.

original: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la bod kyi srad ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la bod kyi srad ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
translated: One large measure of boiled rice, with no husks, of the Māgadha country, is thirty-two seers of Tibet, when uncooked.

original: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
analyzed: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
translated: When calculated in terms of the standard measure, it is seven and a half phul and one khyor.

original: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bre'u chung phyed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi @132a * //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bre'u chung phyed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi @132a * //
translated: One Magadha karsha is equal to one half of a Tibetan bre.

original: yod do // ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do yod do //
analyzed: yod do // ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do yod do //
translated: Two Magadha karshas are equal to one Tibetan bre.
