analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang / chung du'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: de la chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do bcos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang ges mi reg pa'o //
analyzed: de la chen po ni gang du 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do bcos pa sran tshod dang bcas tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na kha'i cha'i mtha' kho na nas mthe bo'i lto gang ges mi reg pa'o //
translated: The large one is the one in which, when dry rice is poured in, it reaches to the brim when a thumb is placed on it, but does not overflow when the bowl is turned upside down.

original: 'bring ni bre'u chung phyed dang do btsos pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni bre'u chung phyed dang do btsos pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The medium one is half a large one.

original: chung du ni bre'u chung gang btsos pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: chung du ni bre'u chung gang btsos pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The small one is the one in which, when dry rice is poured in, it reaches to the brim when a thumb is placed on it, but does not overflow when the bowl is turned upside down.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
translated: A large Magadha-measure of dry rice is sixteen Magadha-palas.

original: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do//
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do//
translated: One Magadha-pala is equal to two Tibetan-palas.

original: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la bos kyi srang ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam po ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la bos kyi srang ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
translated: One Magadha drona of dry, crushed barley is equivalent to thirty-two seers.

original: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //🔽ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi yod do //
analyzed: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do // ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi yod do //
translated: When measured in terms of a full ladle, it is equivalent to seven and a half ladles.🔽Half a Magadha drona is equivalent to three and a half Tibetan khal.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do yod do //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phed dang do la ni bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do yod do //
translated: One Magadha drona is equivalent to seven khal and two Tibetan khal.

original: 'bras drus bskam po chan du btsos na sum 'gyur du brtsi'o //
analyzed: 'bras drus bskam po chan du btsos na sum 'gyur du brtsi'o //
translated: When dry, crushed barley is cooked as porridge, it is considered to triple in volume.

original: de lta na lhung bzed chen po ni 'bras thug po che drus bskam po bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do btsos pa'i chan bre do //
analyzed: de lta na lhung bzed chen po ni 'bras thug po che drus bskam po bod kyi bdun phul bzhi dang khyor do btsos pa'i chan bre do //
translated: Thus, a large begging bowl contains four Tibetan khal and two khal of dry, crushed barley cooked as porridge, and one Tibetan khal of vegetables.

original: de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
translated: When filled with this, it is not quite full to the first joint of the thumb.

original: lhung bzed 'bring ni 'bras thug po che dus pa skam po bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi btsos pa'i chan bre phyed dang do //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'bring ni 'bras thug po che dus pa skam po bod kyi bdun phul phyed dang bzhi btsos pa'i chan bre phyed dang do //
translated: The medium begging bowl is filled with one and a half bre of boiled grain, which is the equivalent of four and a half Tibetan khal of dry grain.

original: de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
translated: When the vegetables that accompany it are added, it is not filled to the first joint of the thumb.🔽The small begging bowl is filled with one bre of boiled grain, which is the equivalent of seven Tibetan khal of dry grain.

original: lhung bzed chung ngu ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam pa bod kyi bdun phul do dang khyor gang btsos pa'i chan bre gang dang de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung ngu ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam pa bod kyi bdun phul do dang khyor gang btsos pa'i chan bre gang dang de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa blugs na mtheb sor gcig gis ma gang ba'o //
translated: When the vegetables that accompany it are added, it is not filled to the first joint of the thumb.

original: 'dir ltung ba'i byed pa po ni lhung bzed 'breng po'i tshad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir ltung ba'i byed pa po ni lhung bzed 'breng po'i tshad dang sbyar te /
translated: Here, the agent of the downfall is a monk who has a large begging bowl.

original: dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether there is one monk, two monks, or many monks,

original: grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas par lhung bzed 'brid po gsum gyi tshad las lhag par mnos @134a * //
analyzed: grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas par lhung bzed 'brid po gsum gyi tshad las lhag par mnos @134a * //
translated: if they take more than three begging bowls’ volume, including the share of companions,

original: te za ba'o //
analyzed: te za ba'o //
translated: and eat it, they have committed a downfall.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are five parts to the basic downfall:🔽The donor is a human being, either a man or a woman, who is a layperson.🔽The alms food is not prepared as desired.

original: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim ba skyes pa 'am bud med gang yang rud pa dang / bstabs pa'i bsod snyoms yongs su spags ba ci bder ma byas pa nyid dang / lhung bzed 'bring po gsum gyi tshad las lhag pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa khyim ba skyes pa 'am bud med gang yang rud pa dang / bstabs pa'i bsod snyoms yongs su spags ba ci bder ma byas pa nyid dang / lhung bzed 'bring po gsum gyi tshad las lhag pa nyid dang /
translated: The bowl is larger than the three measures of a medium bowl.

original: khyim nas mnos te khyer ba dang zos pa'o //
analyzed: khyim nas mnos te khyer ba dang zos pa'o //
translated: The food is taken from the house and eaten.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these parts is missing, there is a serious violation, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparations for the offense of taking more than three bowls, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that are different from the actual basis, there is a minor infraction.

original: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyin bdag mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa za ma dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a human being, but is a neuter, a eunuch, or a hermaphrodite, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chos 'di pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: chos 'di pa dang phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a renunciant of a different religion or a non-Buddhist religion, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a non-human being, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dud 'gro la la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro la la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If the donor is an animal, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi stobs pa len pa la nyes byas so //🔽bsod snyoms mnos pa de las lhag par nod na sbyor ba'i tshon nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi stobs pa len pa la nyes byas so // bsod snyoms mnos pa de las lhag par nod na sbyor ba'i tshon nyes byas so //
translated: If the donor is a weak person, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one accepts more than the amount of alms that one has been invited to receive, there is an offense of wrong conduct for each additional item.

original: gzhan nod du bcug pa la nyes byas so //🔽zas rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan nod du bcug pa la nyes byas so // zas rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one causes another to accept more than the amount of alms that one has been invited to receive, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If the food is not suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma zos kyi bar du sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma zos kyi bar du sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one accepts the food without having eaten, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense for each step of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many steps of preparation as there are, there are that many steps of preparation for the preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for the preparation is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni gal te yongs su spags te stobs la chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yod na lhung bzed brgya blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni gal te yongs su spags te stobs la chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yod na lhung bzed brgya blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one accepts a hundred alms bowls if one has a need for them that is in accord with the Dharma, such as if they are to be used for plastering a temple.

original: ci dgar gyis shig ces ci bder byas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ci dgar gyis shig ces ci bder byas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does whatever one likes with the words, “Do whatever you like.”

original: tshad las ma lhag pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: tshad las ma lhag pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the alms bowl is not beyond the prescribed size.

original: de nyid du 'dug ste ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid du 'dug ste ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one eats as much as one likes right there.

original: 'bras la sogs pa rngo btags pa dang g-yos kyi las sum byas pa mnos te za ba la skabs 'di'i ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa rngo btags pa dang g-yos kyi las sum byas pa mnos te za ba la skabs 'di'i ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one accepts and eats rice and so on that has been threshed and cooked by others.

original: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, one who is insane, one who is the first offender, or one whose mind has been captured by a powerful afflictive emotion.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du lhung bzed do gsum tsham las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o @134b mi stobs par blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du lhung bzed do gsum tsham las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o @134b mi stobs par blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should not rely on, or not accept, taking more than three alms bowls in all circumstances and in all regions, and should not take more than that.

original: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: If he has more than that, he should share it with the monks.

original: thab kyi sgyed po'i steng du gzugs pa'i snod chen pa lta bu'i lhung bzed tshad las 'das par che ba thab snod lta bu bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thab kyi sgyed po'i steng du gzugs pa'i snod chen pa lta bu'i lhung bzed tshad las 'das par che ba thab snod lta bu bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not keep an alms bowl that is too big, like a cooking pot, that is bigger than the standard alms bowl.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: lhung bzed do gsum las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: lhung bzed do gsum las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed de sum cu gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the thirty-third downfall.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium, a commentary on the Prātimokṣa Sūtra,

original: bam po nyi shu bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu bdun pa /
translated: Volume twenty-seven

original: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dar gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dar gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The origin of the downfall of eating food on one seat is twofold:

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the rule: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag nga ni stan gcig pa'i zas za ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga ni stan gcig pa'i zas za ste /
translated: “Monks, I eat food on one seat.

original: nga ltan gcig pa'i zas za ba ni snying las chud dur 'tsho zhing gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod pa yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: nga ltan gcig pa'i zas za ba ni snying las chud dur 'tsho zhing gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod pa yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: Eating food on one seat is a way of life that is free from trouble, has few problems, few worries, is light, healthy, strong, happy, and blameless.
